loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 54 year old man who lives in Beirut, capital of Lebanon with his wife and their four children. Khaled has owned a computer shop since 2006. He sells and repairs computers, as well as he sells computer accessories. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a car for his work because he has a delivery service. This is the first time that Khaled has requested a loan.
Khaled is special in his work because he is trustworthy in his work. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When Ahmad first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. He decided on doing his business because of his experience, as well as he wanted to have an independent work. In the future, he plans on expanding.

loans.use: To purchase a car for his work,

texts.en:
Lea Mukantagaara is 43 years old ,wisdow with four children aged between 18 and 8.
She lives in Gasabo district,Kigali province capital of Rwanda.
Lea owns a small shop for  two years where she sells different kind of products as you find on her picture included .  
She opens everyday her shop from 6h00 to 8h00 PM.
Before the business Lea  was a full time house wife ; and could not get enough income for need of her family.
With this new loan requested in Vision Finance company she hopes to feed her children and find all needs for them such as  school fees and to health care , she believes also to expand her business  .

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her work.

loans.name: God's Gift Group

texts.en:
God’s Gift is a group of 5 borrowers led by James K.B. W.. James is 42 years old and married. His 6 children are 2-9 years old. The range of grades they are enrolled in is from nursery school to third grade. James also cares for 4 siblings.

James is a 10th grade drop-out due to lack of support. He lives in the West Point community in southern downtown Monrovia, Liberia. West Point is a community that is very crowded and is also filled with people who can’t afford a daily meal.

James’s business is selling dry goods like rice, farina, dishes, sugar, and the like. He started this business over 5 years ago with his retirement funds. In Liberia, retirement funds are like a peanut, because they can’t take care of a whole family for 2 months, so James decided to use it to open a small-to-medium business. Today, his business feeds his family.

Because James lives in a community that is home to many fishermen, he sells things that fishermen need. He has been doing well, since most of his customers are those same fishermen. James needs this loan to purchase more dry goods so that he can continue to serve his customers. 

James hopes to become a successful businessman in the field of importation. His dreams include building his own house in a better environment and sending his children to a better school.

loans.use: Purchase more dry goods that can serve the fishermen.

loans.name: Samiah

texts.en:
Samiah is a 42 year old divorced woman who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon. Samiah owns a call center where people come to make international phone calls. Samiah requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase new phone devices for her shop. This is Samiah's first loan.

Samiah's business is unique because she stays open until late in the evening. Her clients are also her friends and neighbors. She did not experience difficulties starting her business.  Samiah decided to start her business because having a job gave her self confidence and independence. In the future, she plans on improving her shop.

loans.use: To purchase new phone devices for her call center.

texts.en:
Theresa trades in vegetables. She is 50 years old, married and has six children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in the town of Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. 
Theresa is the leader of a trust bank group called St. Anthony. The group members are engaged either in farming or trading activities. They supply their local market and nearby communities and sometimes trek to nearby community markets. They want a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.name: Moustafa

texts.en:
Moustafa is a 33 year old man who lives in Beirut, capital of Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Moustafa has been working as a motorcycle repairer since 1999. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase motorcycle spare parts for his work. This is the first time that Moustafa has requested a loan.
Moustafa is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When Moustafa first started his business, he had financial issues. He decided on doing his business because of his experience, as well as he wanted to have an independent work. In the future, he plans on expanding.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts for his work.

loans.name: Jamileh

texts.en:
Jamileh has been working at sewing since 1991. She is a 73-year-old woman who lives in Beirut, the capitA. of Lebanon, with her husband and their two children. Jamileh knows how to treat her clients and has a lot of experience. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. Jamileh decided on this business because of her experience. 

Jamileh requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase thread and repair her sewing machine. Jamileh has been a microcredit client for ten years now and has always paid on time. In the future, she plans on expanding her work.

loans.use: To purchase thread and repair her sewing machine

loans.name: Alber

texts.en:
Alber is a 64 year old man who lives in Beirut, capital of Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Alber has owned a garage mechanic. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools and a car. Alber has been a microcredit client for nine years now and has always paid on time. 
His previous loans helped him improve his work. Alber is special in his work because he does a good work. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When Alber first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. He decided on doing his business because he used to be an employee at Chevrolet and he decided to have an independent work. In the future, he plans on expanding his work.

loans.use: To purchase tools and a car.

texts.en:
Marie louise D. is 32 years old ,married with two children with the following years old : 8 and 6 .
She lives in Gasabo district Kigali province capital of Rwanda where she owns a small shop for 10 years .
Marie louise starts her business everyday from 7h00 AM to 9h00PM.
Before this business Marie Louise was a full time hous wife;and she could not find all needs for her family.
With this new loan from Vision Finance Company she hopes to get more profit which will help her to feed her children to pay school fees for them and also to expand her business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria D. is from the town of Katipunan. She is 43 years old. Gloria is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Gloria owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Gloria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,500 PHP from PMPC. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the  loan taken out by Gloria from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida M. is a 30 year old single mother of one child, Zainabu M.. She lives in Tudor, Mombasa in the coast province of Kenya. 

Farida works with companies in Kuwait seeking to employ people as well as providing clearing and forwarding services for the ports. She has been doing this business for 4 years. She heard of KADET from a friend and joined; she is now accessing her first loan with which she plans to purchase two new computers and a printer for her business. She also plans on using this loan for advertising by  way of posters and a public address system.

Farida hopes to become an importer of household products from Dubai in future.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase two new computers and a printer for her business and advertising

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.en:
S. Shuhrat is a young guy who wishes to improve his business to be able to support his family and offer them a better quality of life. Four years ago, Shuhrat started selling car spare parts. His business has grown little by little; he now offers a variety of products. His starting capital was $1000 US from his savings. Today, Shuhrat has been working with IMON International for more than a year, and feels very satisfied with the support offered to him, because it has allowed him to increase his business, satisfy the needs of his customers and support his family.

Shuhrat applied for a loan of $2400 US in order to purchase new goods for his store. He wants to develop his business and increase his income to save money and create a better life for his family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for cars

loans.name: Abdugaffor

texts.en:
A. Abdugaffor is 48 years old. Together with his wife they’ve raised 4 children. Abdugaffor is running the drug store already for 4 years. He is selling only certified medicines. The drug store is located in the center of the town which allows him to have many clients and customers. Now he requests 3000 Somoni. Being very accurate person by his nature Abdugaffor is sure and would like to ensure the lenders that he is able to pay the loan in time without any violations. Your generosity can change his family living standard.

loans.use: Purchasing medicaments for expanding the business

texts.en: Georgina sells printed textiles. She is 49 years old, married and has four children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in the town of Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. Georgina is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Mpaebo’, meaning ‘Prayer’ The group members are engaged either in farming or trading activities. They supply the local market and nearby communities, sometimes trekking to nearby community markets. They want a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.name: Kyanduru United Joyce Bagonza Group

texts.en: Joyce B. is forty seven years old, the group president. She is married with ten children who are all in school and she also has three dependents schooling too. She is owning a retail shop where she has been operating for over three years. She is using the loan to improve and add capital to her business that is purchasing retail items such as sugar, maize flour, salt, paraffin, soap, etc in order to expand upon her business. Her future dream is educating her children and getting to a better standard of living.

loans.use: To her business that is purchasing retail items such as sugar, maize flour, salt, paraffin, soap, etc in order to expand upon her business.

texts.en:
Radjab has a successful business selling foodstuffs at a market in Rudaki, Tajikistan. He started his business about 13 years ago, after evaluating different business possibilities and deciding this would be the best option and something he would enjoy. Radjab purchases produce at very low prices and then resells at a profit. Because he sells in bulk, he deals with a high inventory turnover rate. Radjab rents a very good location at the market for his business, and he has little competition. He has requested a loan of $800 US to increase his business capital. This loan will give him the ability to purchase more produce to sell, enabling him to increase his profits and continue operating a profitable business.

Abdulatif is a young entrepreneur who started his own business selling foodstuffs six years ago, as a way to help his mother. With hard work and a lot of effort, he has succeeded in growing his business. This is also thanks to daily improvement in the quality of the service and products he offers his clients.

Abdulatif is now married and has a little child. This is his motivation for continuing to improve and grow his business. To cover current demand from his clients, Abdulatif is requesting a loan of 6000 somoni. With your help, Abdulatif will improve the quality of the service he offers his clients and will continue to grow his business. He appreciates the opportunity your support offers him.

loans.name: Bahrom

texts.en:
S. Bahrom is 20 years old. In spite of the fact that Bahrom does not have yet his own family, he is supporting his parents. Bahrom is selling confectionery. He is in this business already for 3 years. This activity generates the main income for the family of Bahrom. As long as Bahrom is very popular in the market by selling the fresh and tasty pastry, he tries to maintain the wide range of goods. Thus, today he requests 7200 Somoni for increasing the variety of confectionery that he sells. With your help, Bahrom will be able to make his business succeed and in the nearest future to make his own family.

loans.use: Purchasing of confectionary for selling and the fodder for the cattle.

loans.name: Mahmasharif

texts.en:
S. Mahmasharif is married and has 4 children. He runs a small grocery business. His place is located on the main market aisle where there are many customers every day. Mahmasharif has been in this business for over 5 years. He is a high achiever and a consistent entrepreneur who is very knowledgeable about the market environment. His professional skills and perseverance have helped to ensure rapid growth and success of his business. Mahmasharif is requesting a loan for 3000 Somoni to increase the assortment of his selling inventory. He is hoping that this loan will help his venture grow and generate extra profits. We believe that Mahmasharif's ability to identify tasks critical to business success and set up a system for accomplishing them will allow him to continue growing in the sphere of private entrepreneurship.

loans.use: Purchasing of foodstuff for increasing the range of selling goods.

texts.en: Jackline is 28 years old and is married to Eric whose occupation is Telecom officer. Jackline has been in the M-Pesa (mobile-phone-based money transfer) and phone accessories business for two years. She has no previous credit history and was introduced to KADET by existing members. Jackline's place of business is densely populated with different types of business. She relies on customers driven by need of the services she offers and also the goods she sells. Jackline aims to obtain a loan to better her business. With the extra profit she intends to increase the cell-phone airtime she can sell so that she can be a Safaricom dealer. Her hopes and dreams are to start a wholesale business to supply several phone accessories. Jackline describes herself as focused and hardworking. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.name: Sadiya

texts.en:
T. Sadiya is a hard working woman and since 2001 has dedicated herself to selling a variety of vegetables. She characterized herself as happy and humble. She started her business with her savings which she had accumulated over a long period of time. Sadiya is the mother of 5 children that she would like to offer an education. Her biggest dream is to prepare her children to have professions so they don't have to suffer like she did since childhood working hard labor. To realize this dream, Sadiya now requests a loan of $800 USD. With this loan she wants to buy more goods to increase her earnings.

loans.use: Increasing of the range of vegetables

loans.name: Mnyanzi

texts.en:
Mnyanzi D. is married and is aged 25 years. She lives in Bamburi, Mombasa with her husband Salim Alfhan who works in a hotel in the area. Mnyanzi runs a grocery store and has been in the business for a year now. 

This is her first loan for her business from any lending organization. With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings from KADET, Mnyanzi plans to buy more groceries in order to satisfy the needs of her customers.

She hopes to establish a permanent structure of her own and to be a major supplier of groceries to households in Bamburi. 

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke “

loans.use: To purchase groceries and to expand her enterprise.

loans.name: In God We Trust Group

texts.en:
In God We Trust is a group of five borrowers led by Fanta D., who is 32 years old, married and has a two-year old child. Fanta is not educated, because before the late 1970’s her tribe, the Mandingo, believed that women did not need to be educated, but rather should rely on their husbands for their daily needs and financial matters. 

To deal with her lack of formal education, she learned tailoring and today both lives and works on McDonald Street in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. She buys clothes wholesale and sells them retail. She also sells jewellery. Her business has been doing well.

Fatu started as a contractor but later opened her own shop. Sometimes, she faces difficulties and challenges because she has so many customers that she has a hard time taking care of all of them. Fatu believes that by buying the right goods and preparing them carefully for sale, she can retain her customers because everyone wants nice clothing.  

Fatu has been in business for more than 10 years but still wants to grow so she can own a big business and improve her skills. She would also like to build a house for her child.  She has applied for this loan to buy more clothes and better serve her customers.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and sell them to her customers.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose S. is currently in the business of selling various items in her shop and is requesting a loan to stock more items in her shop to sell.  

Rose is 40 years old and is Married with a husband that is an accountant. She has 5 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a hotel. 

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock more items in her shop to sell

texts.en:
Francis is 53 years old, married and has four children (ages in parentheses): Rahab (10), Jane (5), Evelyne (18) and Duncan (21).

Francis has been in the stationery business for three years and has no previous credit history. He was introduced to KADET by existing members. His business is located near a school.

He intends reinvest the loan into his business and use profits to pay for his children's tuition and purchase more inventory to expand the business.

Francis describes himself as focused, hardworking and humble. His aspirations are to open a general bookshop, which also sells school uniforms to generate more profit.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba P. owns an accessories shop and is requesting a loan to purchase more earrings to sell.

Araba is 48 years old and is married to a carpenter. She has one child whom does not go to school. With the profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her family.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more earrings to sell.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert K. is 52 years old and is a married father of two. He lives with his family in Bamburi, Mombasa. Robert runs a store in King'orani where he manufactures and sells food spices. He has been in this business for 15 years.

Previously, Robert was a client of another Kenyan MFI - Faulu Kenya for three years.  This is his first loan from KADET and with the money, he plans to purchase stock for food spice production. The demand for Robert's products is high because he offers a variety of spices.

He hopes to become a leading supplier of food spices in Mombasa city.  

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke.

loans.use: To purchase stock for food spice production.

loans.name: Malakeh

texts.en:
Malakeh is a 48 year old woman who lives in Tripoli, northern Lebanon with her husband and their seven children. Malakeh owns a grocery store. She also sells home products. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her shop. This is her fourth cycle loan and she has always paid on time. 
Malakeh is special in her work because she knows how to treat her clients. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and others. When she first started her business, she had financial issues. She decided to enter into this business because she wanted to improve her financial situation. In the future, she plans to expand her work by opening a clothing shop.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her shop.

Botul is 30 years old and is Married with a husband that is a police man. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 40 year old man who lives in Tripoli, northern Lebanon with his wife and their five children. Mahmoud has been working as a garage mechanic. He requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase spare parts for his business. Mahmoud has been a microcredit client for five years now and has always paid on time. 
His previous loans helped him improve his garage by purchasing new and modern tools. His clients are the people from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Mahmoud decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his garage business.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a 44 year old woman who lives in Tripoli, northern Lebanon with her husband and their two children. Salma has been working as a seamstress, from her home. She requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase a new and more modern sewing machine. This is the first time that Salma has requested a loan. 
Salma is speciA. in her work because of her experience and her work quality. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. She decided on doing her business because of her experience. In the future, she plans on expanding and opening a sewing shop.

loans.use: To purchase a new and more modern sewing machine.

Khaled is special in his work because he is known for his good work. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Khaled decided on doing his business because he wanted to have an independent work.

loans.name: Mugoma Kweterana Sembo Mary Group

texts.en: S. Mary is forty-seven years old representing her loan group. She is a married business woman blessed with two children and having four dependents going to school. She is a farmer and she has been a farmer for over twenty-three years. She is requesting for the loan to maintain her banana plantation by purchasing fertilizer (manure), pay wages etc for the better produces. She is grateful for loan offering by Kiva, she will double the efforts to see that she succeeds in maintaining her plantation. Her dream is to see the standard of living in her home is improving.

loans.use: To maintain her banana plantation by purchasing fertilizer (manure), pay wages etc for the better produces.

loans.name: Sami

texts.en:
Sami is a 44-year-old divorced man who lives in Tripoli, Northern Lebanon. Sami has been working as a car repairer. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase car oil and new tools for his garage. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time. 
His previous loan helped him improve his work. Sami is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he had difficulty finding the proper place to open his garage. Sami decided on doing his business because he wanted to improve his income. In the future, he plans on expanding.

loans.use: To purchase car oil and new tools for his garage.

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en: Hajara is 50 years old and married with six children between 18 and 25 years. Only two of her children go to school. Hajara resides in and rents a two-room house where she is staying with eight people. There is electricity but no piped water at home. Hajara doesn’t take care of any additional family members.  The family gets two meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area in the outskirts of Kampala and works two days a week. Hajara sells to all categories of people. Hajara deals in cattle. She buys cows from villages and sells them to meat packers and at times to Kampala city abattoir. She incurs extra transport costs to and from the villages. The major challenges she faces in her business are seasonality and the increasing prices of cattle. Hajara has been in this business for two years. She first dealt in tomatoes.  She has been with MCDT for seven years, servicing her 14th loan working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more cattle for resale.  Hajara aspires to see her business grow bigger and own a permanent home and a butcher shop.

loans.use: To buy more cattle for resale

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida M. lives in the village of Sitio, Cagay, Brgy. Su-ay, in the City of Himamaylan Negros Occidental. She is 47 years old and married to Rodolfo M., a Provincial Government employee. They have 12 children - the oldest is 27 years old and the youngest is only three. Most of their children are still in school. Even with such a big family to feed and raise, Leonida is contented with her life, determined to take care of her children and prepare them to face life once they're all grown up. She is indefatigable in her role as mother and wife.

To help her husband increase their income and set aside some money for their future security, Leonida set up a general store. When she started, she only had a little capital so she just carried the most basic household commodities that were in demand in her neighborhood. She decided not to sell food or candies in her store because she knew that her children would not be able to resist eating them, diminishing their income. For several years, she continued to just rollover her capital, earning a very small income. While it helped with their family expenses, her store was not expanding. She joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1995 to gain access to additional income so that she could finally expand her business. 

As her income continued to improve, she was able to pay off her loans on time and maintain a good credit record with NWTF-Project Dungganon. Later, Leonida invested in a backyard hog-fattening project, which allowed her to involve her children in an income-generating activity by letting them take care of the pigs as part of their daily chores.  She has been operating her general store for 19 years now and she testifies that her continuing success is because she is dedicated, works hard, perseveres and is disciplined in her pursuit. This has improved the quality of life of her family. She presently earns PHP 6,000 average monthly profit from her business and it helps to pay for the family expenses, allows her to afford sending her children to school, and contributes to making their life more comfortable than before. 

Her previous loan of PHP 18,000 was used to add to her working capital. She paid all of her weekly installments on time and the loan was paid in full within its loan term. Now she is borrowing PHP 15,000 for her 16th loan cycle, again to invest in the expansion of her product offerings in her general store. She intends to use the income from this loan to do some house repair, pay for the tuition of her children and provide them with their daily allowance. 


About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional Capital for General Store and Hog-Fattening

loans.name: Angele

texts.en:
Angele M. is 48 years old and is married with four children aged between 18 and 7. She lives in the Gasabo district of Kigali, the capital of Rwanda, where she has sold foodstuffs for 18 years.

Before this business, Angele was a full-time housewife and was not able to supply all the needs of her family. With this new loan from Vision Finance Company, she plans to purchase a fridge for cooling her produce. With the extra profit from the produce she sells, Angele hopes to expand her business, get more food for her family and pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator for her produce

texts.en:
Salaam is a group of five borrowers led by Kumba H., 38 years old. She is married with four children aged 9-20 years old and their educational levels are 4th-11th grade. Kumba also cares for one sibling. She is an illiterate due to lack of financial support because her parents were poor. Kumba lives and works in WestPoint, a slum in downtown Monrovia, Liberia.

Kumba’s business is cook bowl. She buys rice, oil, meat, seasons, etc and cooks and sells to the residents of WestPoint, Monrovia, Liberia. Because the majority of those who reside in WestPoint can’t afford a daily meal, they prefers Kumba’s cook bowl, which is cheap and well seasoned. 
Kumba is very popular in that community. She realized that seasoning her food and cooking it well makes her customers keep coming to buy her food. Kumba has been running this business for more than four years. She started this business from money she borrowed from her brother. Kumba needs this loan to purchase cooking ingredients in bulk, to cook enough food to serve all her customers. She also aims to grow her cook shop up to restaurant standard and even bigger. Kumba dreams of giving her children a good education and building a big house for her and her family.

She has two children who are both in school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a hotel.

texts.en:
Gloria M. is 31 years old and is married with six children aged between 13 and 2. She also looks after three dependents.

Gloria has been in the business of selling loincloths for five years, working eleven hours a day and creating jobs for two employees. After realizing that her investment is too low to earn more profit, she is now requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing more loincloths.

By using this loan, Gloria hopes, with the profit she will get, to help her husband to build their own house and pay school fees for their children.

Nyadid M. is currently in the business of selling beer from her home and is requesting a loan to open up a bar at the nearby market. Nyadid is 29 years old and married; her husband is a soldier. She has two children and they go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy more chairs and tables to improve the bar and also to buy more refrigerators.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

Leonila D. is 57 years old, married with seven children ranging in age from 17 to 37 years old, with the youngest still going to school. The D. family lives in the village of Brgy, Rizal, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. Some of her children worked so that they could help shoulder the family's expenses. As her children grew older, the family expenses also increased, and it became obvious that her husband's income would not be able to sustain the family's increasing needs. This situation made her decide to start her own business to augment the family income. 

Leonila started a small food vending business in her local community. She sells "bananacue" and "camotecue' - made by frying whole bananas and sliced sweet potatoes, then adding brown sugar into the oil once the banana or sweet potato is cooked, and caramelizing the sugar until it coats the banana or sweet potato. It is called "bananacue" and "camotecue" because they are sold skewered in bamboo barbecue sticks. She also sells "Halo-halo" - literally meaning mixed. "Halo-halo" is made with a mixture of candied fruit and jellies, scraped ice, milk and sugar. Corn Flakes and Leche Flan (Caramelized milk custard) are also added in many "halo-halo" recipes, and it can be topped with ice cream to make it more special. This is very popular during the hot summer months. She also sells ice candy made with frozen fruit juice or a frozen milk-based mixture.

Aside from her food vending business, Leonila also sells Ready-to-Wear clothes. She's been operating this business for thirty-seven years now and she continues to maintain a good relationship with her customers and maintains the good quality of her products. She earns about $88 a month from her business activities. The income covers some of the family income, provides the allowance of her youngest child who still goes to school, and the balance is reinvested into the business. 

Leonila has retained her good record with the Kiva field partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon. She paid off her thirteenth loan of PHP 19,500 on time, and it went a long way in providing her with a revolving working capital for her business. Now she is borrowing PHP 17,000 for her 14th cycle loan. She intends to use this loan to add to her working capital.


About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.name: Jaqueline

Jacqueline has been in the business of selling clothes for one year, working almost ten hours a day and creating a job for one employee. But the profit is still low and, for that reason, Jacqueline is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company to expand her business through purchasing more clothes to sell.

By using this new loan in her business, Jacqueline hopes to earn more profit than before. Through accessing this new loan, Jacqueline has a hope for the future.

texts.en:
Said N. is 35 years old, married with 4 children aged between 14 and 2 and 5 dependents.

Said has been in the business of shopping for a period of 15 years working 14 hours a day by employing 2 employees. Though that period, Said could not make enough profits. So in order to make more profits than before, Said is requesting his first loan from Vision Finance Company s.a  for expanding his business through purchasing more shopping goods like 10 sacs of salt and sugar,12 carton of cooking oil  etc

Through the use of this loan, Said hopes to get more profit and with that profit, he plans to pay school fees and get more food for his family.

Lurinada C. is 50 years old and married with five children. Her oldest child is 30 years old and the youngest is 22.  The family presently resides in the village of Brgy. Rizal, City of Sagay, Negros Occidental. Her husband works in the sugar mill in Sagay, but his income is not enough to sustain all the needs of their family. As a housewife, Lurinada is the one who budgets the family income, and she saw that it was not enough to support their family. She thought that it would be a good idea to have another source of income to supplement her husband's income.  

To have access to capital to build her own business, Lurinada joined the Kiva field partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, in 2000.  With her first loan she set up a general store adjacent to their house.  Even though she  earned only a small income when she started, she persevered and reinvested part of her profits back into the business, and industriously paid her weekly loan installments. As she built her good credit rating with NWTF-Project Dungganon, she was able to access a larger loan, and with it she expanded her business activities and started selling dried fish, which further increased her income potential. 

For over nine years, she managed to expand her business and this gave her an average monthly net profit of $109, which has been a big help to the family. Lurinada continues to maintain her good credit record: she just paid off her thirteenth loan of PHP 19,500 without a single delay. Now she is borrowing another PHP 19,500 to add to her revolving working capital for her business ventures.


About NWTF:

loans.name: Villa Florida Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Villa Florida, se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad de Huanchos, distrito de Chinchihuasi, Provincia de Churcampa, departamento de Huancavelica. Esta Comunidad está a 45 minutos del distrito de Paucarbamba, comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, así como al comercio.

Sonilda, es madre soltera, tiene 01 hijo. Sonilda es una mujer muy emprendedora, ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en su pequeña bodega, vende dulces en un colegio y también cría y vende animales menores en su casa. Gracias a sus préstamos y el apoyo de su familia ella sigue haciendo crecer sus negocios. Con su nuevo préstamo, ella comprará mercadería para su bodega y aumentara la crianza de sus animales.

Máxima, es casada y tiene 01 hijo. Ella se dedica hace mucho tiempo a la venta de abarrotes, negocio en el cual le ayuda su esposo e hijo. Máxima, se abastece de productos en la ciudad y los lleva a su comunidad para su venta, por ello solicita un préstamo para comprar mercadería y surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
The Villa Florida Communal Bank is located in the community of Huanchos, Chinchihuasi distrcit, Churcampa province, Huancavelica department. This community is 45 minutes from the Paucarbamba district and is dedicated to agriculture and cattle farming as well as commerce. Sonilda is a single mother of one son. She is a very enterprising woman who sells groceries in her small store as well as candies and sweets at a local school. She also breeds and sells small animals from her home. Thanks to her loans and the support of her family, her business continues to grow. With her new loan, she will buy merchandise for her store and increase the number of animals she breeds. Máxima is married and has one son. She has sold groceries for a long time, and her husband and her son help her with the business. Máxima stocks up on products in the city and brings them back to sell in her community. She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise to stock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The Villa Florida Communal Bank is requesting a loan to invest in 16 member businesses.

loans.name: Redempta

texts.en:
Redempta U. is 36 years old and is married with two children: one is 10 years old and the other one is 6 years old.

Redempta has owned her grocery store for eight years and has created jobs for two people working fourteen hours a day.

Redempta is not earning enough profit from her business. So, for that reason, she needs a loan from Vision Finance Company to expand her business by buying more lemonade, mineral water, sugar and rice in order to earn more profits than before.

Through the use of this loan, Redempta hopes to earn more profit. Then, with that profit, she plans to help her husband to build their own house and pay school fees for their children.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her shop

loans.name: 410400013 Group

texts.es:

Doménica, es casada y tiene 04 hijos. Doménica se dedica a tejer artesanías y chompas, las cuales venD. en las minas, con la ayuda D. su familia. Doménica solicita un préstamo, dinero con el cual se abastecerá D. materia prima para sus tejidos, con lo cual conseguirá mantener un buen stock D. sus productos. 

Alicia es conviviente y tiene 02 hijos. Alicia se dedica a la compra y venta D. animales pequeños, los cuales adquiere en las comunidades y venD. en las ferias con el apoyo D. su esposo y algunos familiares. Alicia, solicita un préstamo, con el cual adquirirá mas animales para su negocio. Alicia, esta ahorrando para brindarle una mejor calidad D. vida a sus hijos.

loans.use: El Bancomunal Los Saucos solicita un préstamo de 7,300 soles para que sus 13 socias inviertan en sus negocios

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal U. is 46 years old, is married with five children, and she takes care of eight dependents.

Chantal has been in the business of selling clothes for fiive years, working ten hours a day, but her monthly earnings are still low. For that reason, she is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding her business through buying more clothes to sell.

By receiving this loan, Chantal hopes to earn more profit than before. Then, through that profit, she will be able to provide more food for her family and pay her children’s school fees.

loans.name: Roosevelt's Group

texts.en:
New Connection is a group of five borrowers led by Roosevelt B., who is 46 years old and married with six children. They range in age from five to twenty years old and are enrolled in school at levels from kindergarten to tenth grade. B. also cares for two siblings.

B. is a high school graduate but because he never had the means of attending a university, he decided to go into business. He lives in Congo Town, Monrovia, Liberia. Congo Town is a mixed community of poor and middle class Liberians.

B.’s business is footwear. He buys wholesale and sells retail to residents of downtown Monrovia, Liberia. He has been 
running this business for more than nine years and believes the key to success in business is serving your customers with good products, and that is just what B. has been doing.

B. is able to provide for his family with the income from this business and wants to expand his business to the level of owning a store. He needs this loan to purchase more footwear at wholesale prices and sell at retail to acquire more profits. He dreams of giving his children a better education so that they can fit into society.

loans.use: To purchase more footwear to sell.

texts.en:
Flordeliza G., 71, is a widow with nine adult children from the village of Brgy. Gargato, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She may be a senior citizen with children ranging in age from 30 to 50, but she is a strong independent woman.

Flordeliza joined NWTF-Project Dungganon 16 years ago with the objective of setting up her own business and helping her husband support their family. She also liked the idea of being a member of an organization that empowers women out of poverty, and she used her first cycle loan to open a coffee shop adjacent to their house. With the help of her husband and children, she was able to build her business, and her coffee shop became a favorite among the locals, earning enough to be a significant help in meeting their family's expenses.

When her husband died, she was not left bereft as she had the means to continue supporting herself and her family. It also helped when her adult children started earning their own living, easing her financial burden. As time passed, Flordeliza was able to buy a motorcycle with a sidecar for passengers which currently earns her additional income. Now that all of her children have their own families, Flordeliza is content that she is not a burden to them in her old age.

In the 16 years that she has been a member, she has maintained a good credit record with NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her last loan of PHP 15,000 was fully repaid on time without any delays in the weekly installments. Now she is requesting another PHP 15,000 to add to her revolving working capital for her coffee shop.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day to achieving realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

texts.es:
Felix Pedro S. M. es un señor de 74 años de edad el cual vive con su esposa y su único hijo en una comunidad llamada las Nubes localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

Don Felix se ha dedicado desde muy joven a la ganadería de doble propósito, tanto en producción de leche y queso como la venta de carne; ya que es una forma de generar ingresos para su familia. Dice estar muy contento porque gracias a este proyecto ha podido salir adelante, dandole una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. 

Don Felix desea obtener un micro crédito por un monto de ¢200.000 (doscientos mil colones) para comprar una vaca más y así aumentar la producción. El sabe que contar con más vacas es un mayor sacrificio y demandará más trabajo. Sin embargo, el deseo de ser una microempresario exitoso y sacar adelante a su familia mejorando las condiciones de vida, lo motiva a esforzarse con gran esmero y dedicación.

Don Felix es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Las Nubes, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer crédito y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.

She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. Felicia is a trader. She trades in footwear. She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Obaapa’, meaning a virtuous woman. The group members are engaged either in farming and/or trading activities. They sell/supply in their local market and nearby communities. They sometimes trek to nearby community markets. They want a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand their businesses.

Regina is thirty – two years old. She is married and has give birth to four children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. Regina is a trader. She trades in vegetables. She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Nhyira nka boafo’, blessed be unto a helper. The group members are engaged either in farming and/or trading activities. They sell/supply in their local market and nearby communities. They sometimes trek to nearby community markets. They want a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand their businesses.

Monica is thirty – nine years old. She is married and has give birth to three children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. Monica is a food vendor. She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Time is money. The group members are engaged either in farming and/or trading activities. They sell/supply in their local market and nearby communities. They sometimes trek to nearby community markets. They want a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.name: Mirador De Carabayllo Group

texts.es:
La Sra. GLADYS MILAGROS Z. R., quien se encuentra sentada en la fotografía; tiene 39 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos varones, menores D. edad. Ella forma parte del Grupo “El Mirador D. Carabayllo” integrado por 10 socios activos.

Hace diez años, cuando su esposo perdió el trabajo, y al notar que pasaba por muchas necesidades primordiales como alimentación, vestimenta y estudio D. sus hijos, tuvo la iniciativa D. poner un negocio, que le pudiera dar un  ingreso todos los días y a la vez le diera tiempo para atender a sus pequeños hijos luego que ellos regresaran del colegio.

Así,  empezó a trabajar vendiendo jugo D. naranja en una avenida principal, inició con un pequeño préstamo que pudo conseguir, con el que adquirió las herramientas necesarias que en éste caso eran el pelador D. naranjas, el exprimidor, unas mesitas, vasos, las naranjas y azúcar.

Con su trabajo, ella ha podido apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares, adquirió algunos muebles para su casa, trasladó a sus hijos a un colegio particular.

Hoy en día, han adquirido 2 autos para hacer taxi, y le gustaría en un futuro no muy lejano tener una empresa D. taxis constituida formalmente.

El préstamo solicitado lo destinará la compra D. llantas para uno D. los autos para que pueda pasar la revisión técnica, requisito indispensable para dar servicio D. taxi en Lima.
texts.en:
Gladys Milagros Z. R., who appears seated in the photograph, is 39 years old and married with two sons who are minors. She is part of the "El Mirador D. Carabayllo" group, which consists of 10 active members. Ten years ago when her husband lost his job, she realized that they were lacking many basic necessities such as food, clothing, and education for their children, and she took the initiative to start a business which would proviD. her with income each day and at the same time leave her with time to take care of her small children after they came home from school. So, she began to work selling orange juice on a major road, starting her business with a small loan that she was able to secure and with which she acquired the necessary tools, which in this case were an orange peeler, a juicer, a few small tables, glasses, oranges, and sugar. With her work, she has been able to support her husband and cover household expenses, purchase some furniture for her home, and move her children to a private school. Today, they have acquired two cars to use as taxis, and in the near future she would like to formally open a taxi service business. The loan requested is intended for the purchase of tires for one of the cars so that it can pass inspection, an absolute requirement to proviD. taxi service in Lima.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest in a new business idea

loans.name: Felicia María

texts.es:
Felicia María G. S. es una señora de 45 años de edad la cual vive con uno de sus cuatro hijos en una comunidad llamada las Nubes localizada en los chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

Doña Felicia se dedica a la agricultura, en estos momentos ella se dedica a la siembra de ñame, un tubérculo de agradable sabor, rico en nutrientes, de procesamiento agroindustrial amplio y de gran demanda tanto en Costa Rica como en otros países.

Actualmente doña Felicia está solicitando un préstamo de ¢500,000 (quinientos mil colones), para ampliar su siembra y así ayudarse con  la preparación del suelo, compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos entre otros insumos que sean necesarios para garantizar la siembra óptima del ñame. 

Con esta inversión  espera lograr una buena cosecha, con un producto de características apropiadas para conseguir un precio de venta alto. Con esto desea iniciar un proyecto exitoso que le permita mejorar las condiciones de su familia.

Doña Felicia es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Las Nubes, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su cuarto préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.

loans.use: Mantenimiento y compra de insumos para siembra de ñame

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Twere Nyankopon’, meaning depend on God. The group members are engaged either in farming and/or trading activities. They sell/supply in their local market and nearby communities. They sometimes trek to nearby community markets. They want a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand their businesses.

Agyei is thirty – nine years old. He is married and has give birth to three children, all in school. He runs a licensed chemical store. She is the leader of a trust bank group called Jehovah. The group members are engaged either in farming and/or trading activities. They sell/supply in their local market and nearby communities. They sometimes trek to nearby community markets. They want a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand their businesses.

texts.es:
Nuestro socio se llama Donny, el pertenece al banco comunal grupo esperanza, el vive en la urb. Santa Beatriz D-4, en la cuidad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio tiene 27 años de edad el es soltero, y trabaja como empleado de la empresa Limagas, el maneja la pequeña camioneta de la empresa para poder así repartir a las diferentes casas que hacen el pedido de gas, el trabaja como chofer y repartidor de gas, el solicita el préstamo para poder invertir en un proyecto propio y así mejorar su calidad de vida.

Nuestro socio se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

texts.en: Comfort is forty – five years old. She is married and has give birth to six children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. Comfort is a food vendor. She runs a chop bar. She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Tumi wura’, literally meaning one in authority. The group members are engaged either in farming and/or trading activities. They sell/supply in their local market and nearby communities. They sometimes trek to nearby community markets. They want a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.name: Esperanza Asegurada 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Emilio is a 50-year-old borrower who lives near San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic. He is the coordinator of a borrowing group called Esperanza Asegurada (Hope Assured), and his story is representative of the other borrowers in the group. 

Emilio lives in Batey Vasca, which is about 30 minutes by truck outside of San Pedro de Macorís. A batey is a community of sugarcane field workers in the rural areas of the Dominican Republic. Bateyes are very remote, hard to access, and most people live in deep poverty. They often lack potable water, medicine, and any kind of reliable electricity.

Despite these difficulties, Emilio runs a successful colmado in his community. Colmados are small local shops that carry anything from bread to batteries; Emilio’s colmado is small, and he focuses on selling food. With this loan, Emilio will purchase rice, beans, and bread, among other types of food from the Dominican cuisine. 

Emilio lives in a small home in his batey with his wife and four children. His home is made from cement blocks, and was built by the local sugar company. He has lived here for 25 years. Emilio stays in business to support his family, and he hopes that with the money from his colmado he can send his children to school so they can "become professionals in any field they enjoy". This is Emilio’s sixth loan with Esperanza, and he hopes that it will not be his last.

loans.use: Rice, beans, and bread to sell to his community

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

texts.en: Lympia is fifty – one years old. She is divorced and has give birth to three children, all in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. She is a seamstress and the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Ntease’, meaning understanding. The group members are engaged either in farming and/or trading activities. They sell/supply in their local market and nearby communities. They sometimes trek to nearby community markets. They want a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand their businesses.

texts.es:
Nuestro socio se llama Jean Paul, el vive en la urb. Santa Beatriz B-4, el pertenece al banco comunal  grupo esperanza.

El socio tiene 37 años de edad, el es soltero y tiene i hijo, nuestro socio es un hombre trabajador y el amor absoluto a su pequeño hijo, lo hace trabajar de sol a sol, el alterna todas sus actividades con el comercio minorista, nuestro socio se dedica a la venta de ropa para niños. El socio requiere el préstamo para usarlo como capital de trabajo, con este dinero el lo reinvertirá en comprar mayor cantidad de ropa y así mismo venderlas.

Nuestro socio se encuentra sumamente agradecido por el apoyo brindado y se compromete en cumplir con el pago en el plazo estipulado.

texts.en: Elizabeth is thirty – seven years old. She is divorced and has give birth to four children, all in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. Elizabeth is a trader. She trades in pastries. She supplies to retailers and snack bar operators in her community. Elizabeth also hawks to sell in her community. She buys her goods from nearby towns. She has been in business for over twelve years and wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

Yaa is 27 years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, both in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. Yaa is a trader. She trades in crates of eggs. She supplies to retailers and beverage sellers in her community. Yaa also treks to nearby community markets to sell. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand their businesses.

texts.es:
La socia se llama Yeny, ella pertenece al banco del grupo esperanza, es socia activa y junto a su pareja, trabajan juntos.

La socia tiene 30 años  de edad, ella es conviviente y  tiene 1 pequeño hijo, nuestra socia alterna sus diferentes actividades del hogar con la venta de ropa, ella junto a su pareja compran ropa al por mayor y la venden, nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para poder adquirir mayor mercadería y así seguir vendiendo sus diferentes prendas.

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.

La socia se llama Lizbeth, ella pertenece al banco del grupo esperanza, ella vive en el barrio D. kari granD. en la letra F-7, en la ciudad D. Cusco.

La socia tiene 52 años D. edad, ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades con la venta D. cosméticos D. belleza y otros mediante catálogos, la socia lleva sus catálogos D. belleza a diferentes lugares, amigas, empresas y otros , una ves que le piden diferentes accesorios y cosméticos ella reparte los pedidos y así los va cobrando, nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para reinvertir en su negocio y en algunos otros pequeños pendientes.

Nuestra socia agradece el préstamo y valora el apoyo brindado y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. su deuda en el plazo establecido.

El Sr. SATURNINO P. R.,a quien apreciamos en la fotografía sentado; tiene 43 años de edad, está felizmente casado y tiene un hijo que está cursando la secundaria. Actualmente el Sr. Saturnino, es el Secretario de la ALCOM “Mujeres Fuertes y Unidas”, reside en la zona de Comas al igual que los 10 socios que la integran.

El Sr. Saturnino hace cinco años se dedica a atender su negocio de nombre Nino’s Burguer, ofreciendo a su clientela comida rápida como sanguches, salchipapas y pollos broaster.

El nos cuenta que luego de seis años prestando servicios como vendedor en una empresa privada, con el dinero que recibió de su liquidación, adquirió un carrito sanguchero, con el que inicia su negocio, ubicándose en la acera de su casa.

Con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo pudo adquirir poco a poco mesas, sillas y ha equipado un espacio de su casa especialmente para atender a mas clientes y estos consuman su comida en un ambiente cómodo.

Gracias a su trabajo, él ha logrado tener una estabilidad y tranquilidad económica, no pasan por necesidades graves, y se pueden darse gustos como paseos en familia ya que para él ellos don lo más importante y son quienes los motivan a trabajar más y progresar.

Su sueño es ampliar su negocio, modernizarlo y abrir otros locales.
El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de insumos.
texts.en:
Mr. Saturnino P. R. (the man sitting in the picture) is 43 years old, happily married, and has a son in high school. Mr. Saturnino is the current secretary for ALCOM “Mujeres Fuertes and Unidad.” He, and the other ten members of the group, all live in the Comas area. Mr. Saturnino has worked at his business, Nino’s Burger, selling fast food like sandwiches, fries, and broasted chicken for five years. He tells us that after working as a vendor in a private company for 6 years, he bought a sandwich cart with his severance pay. He parks his cart on the sidewalk in front of his home. Bit by bit and after a lot of hard work, he was able to get some tables and chairs and has turned part of his house into a place where his customers can eat comfortably. Thanks to his job, he has been able to reach some economic stability and tranquility. They don’t lack for basic necessities and can enjoy a few family activities like trips. The most important thing for them is to want to work and to get ahead. He hopes to grow his business by modernizing it and opening other locations. He plans to buy supplies with the loan money.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El socio se llama Francisco, el pertenece al banco comunal grupo esperanza, nuestro socio vive en la av. Humberto Vidal Unda 530 y tiene su negocio en la av. la raza 883, en la ciudad del Cusco.

El socio es casado, tiene 58 años de edad y tiene  2 hijos, el alterna sus actividades con la sastrería, nuestro socio hace liadísimos trajes para toda ocasión, el socio tiene su pequeño taller sastrería en la av. la raza 883, nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para poder utilizarlo como capital de trabajo, el se muestra muy satisfecho y agradecido.

Nuestro socio se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el tiempo estipulado.
texts.en:
The member's name is Francisco; he belongs to the community bank Grupo Esperanza (Group of Hope) and lives at 530 Humberto Vidal Unda Avenue. He has his business at 883 La Raza Avenue in the city of Cusco. The member is married, is 58 years old, and has two children. He alternates his activities with tailoring. Our member makes wonderful dresses and suits for every occasion. The member has his small tailor shop at 883 La Raza Avenue. Our member is requesting the loan to be able to use it for working capital. He is very pleased and grateful. Our member commits to comply with making the payments on his loan in the stipulated time.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working ca[ital for the tailor shop

texts.es:
Nuestra socia se llama Ayda, ella pertenece al banco comunal grupo esperanza. La socia vive en kari grande E- 11 B, en el distrito de san Sebastián en la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 33 años ella es conviviente y tienen 2 hijos, la socia es natural de Huamanga Ayacucho, y reside en la ciudad del Cusco más de 3 años, ella tiene su  tienda de abarrotes vende diversos productos, la socia requiere el préstamo para poder abastecer su negocio y así tener mayor ingreso.

Del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago total de su deuda en el plazo establecido.

El socio es el SR: Angel, el pertenece al banco comunal grupo esperanza. El socio vive en el distrito de san Sebastián en la ciudad D. Cusco

Nuestro socio tiene 54 años de edad, el es  casado y tiene 4 hijos, nuestro socio es de profesión ingeniero civil, él se encuentra formando parte D. banco debido a que siempre un ingreso extra es beneficiosos para todos y es precisamente este modo de banca financiera la que le ha permitido adquirir sus electrodomésticos y demás, el socio solicita el préstamo para una inicial de un nuevo artefacto. El socio respalda sus préstamos con el trabajo fijo que tiene de ingeniero civil.

Nuestro socio agradece el apoyo brindado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Angel belongs to the communal bank "Esperanza." He lives in the district of San Sebastian in the city of Cusco Nuestro. He is a 45-year-old civil engineer, married, with 4 children. He joined the bank because the access to credit is beneficial for everyone and it is precisely due to this mode of financing that he was able to acquire his household appliances. He is requesting the loan for a new appliance. Angel backs up this loan with his permanent job as a civil engineer. He is grateful for the support that has been provided, and he pledges to make the payments on his debt in the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: Ángela del Carmen F. L. tiene la actividad de mercadería en general. Ella tiene 32 años, es una mujer muy alegre y disfruta mucho de su trabajo, Ángela tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000, por lo que siempre los financiamientos han sido de gran ayuda. A pesar de los problemas que ha obtenido como es su salud. Actualmente ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra ropa para damas, cosméticos, calzado y otras prendas de vestir. Su deseo es seguir trabajando para tener los ingresos necesarios para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Ángela del Carmen F. L. sells general merchandise. She is a very happy 32 year old woman, and she greatly enjoys her work. Angela has worked with the Fundación León 2000 for a long time. In spite of the health problems she has had, the loans have always been a big help. She is currently asking for a loan for working capital to buy women’s clothes, cosmetics, footwear, and other articles of clothing. Her wish is to keep working to have the income she needs to get ahead with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Jacqueline, ella pertenece al banco comunal grupo esperanza. La socia vive en Manuel prado J-4, en el distrito de san Huanchac en la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 33 años de edad, ella es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo, la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio, ella es trabajadora en un taller de artesanía y también exportan artesanía, nuestra socia requiere el préstamo para poder hacer uso con parte de ello en la compra de algunos artefactos para su hogar y con otro tanto poder abastecerse de víveres.

Nuestra socia agradece el préstamo otorgado comprometiéndose así a cumplir con el pago total de su deuda.
texts.en:
Jacqueline belongs to the Esperanza Communal Bank. She lives in Manuel Prado J-4, in the San Huanchac district in the city of Cusco. She is a 33 year old single mother, and she has one child. She alternates her activities between home and business. She works in a handicrafts shop, and she exports handicrafts. She needs a loan to be able to use part of it to buy some fixtures for her home. With the other part of the loan she will be able to stock up on supplies. She is grateful for the loan she was given, and she promises to pay it all back.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

This is Abdul K., Yeabu K., Fatmata B. K., Zainab K. and Sallamatu K.. Small-scale businesspeople in Makeni City, located in northern Sierra Leone, they call their group Best of All. They have received several loans from Kiva through SMT, always repaying their loans on time and in full. Their previous loan for Le 1,000,000 each helped them a great deal, enabling them to solve many of their problems through increased profits. Today, they are requesting a loan of Le 1,300,000 each to further add to their businesses.

Abdulai K. (on the right in the photo) is the leader of this group. Abdulai, 39 and born in Makeni City, is a married father of four – two in secondary schools, one in primary school and the last not yet of school age. Abdulai, a businessman for the over five years now, sells medicines.

loans.name: Hazel Ivania

texts.es: La joven Hazel Hernández de 23 años de edad, es una joven esforzada ya que ha logrado terminar su carrera en ingeniería en sistema, debido al poco empleo en Nicaragua no ha logrado encontrar trabajo en su especialidad pero espera lograrlo, trabaja como recepcionista desde hace dos años. Es casada y reside en un barrio de la capital 380, con una niña de dos meses, su esposo se desempeña como aforador en una aduana y es responsable. Tiene un negocio de venta de ropa en casa de su mama, pues vende al contado y al crédito aunque tiene poco inventario su meta es poder volver a crecer en sus ventas, ya que su objetivos es poder remodelar su casa, con este crédito invertirá en cerámica para poner en un cuarto, este es su tercer ciclo en Afodenic  y esta contenta por lograr sus objetivos con su casa. A futuro espera seguir trabajando con la institución.

loans.use: Comprar ceramica para poner en el cuarto

loans.name: Erick Antonio

texts.es: El joven Erick M. de 29 años de edad, labora en la cooperativa de transporte urbano de la capital de Managua, el cual desde los 19 años comenzó a trabajar ya que se caso a temprana edad, su esposa le tiene dos hijos y reside en el barrio Camilo Ortega, cuando comenzó a trabajar empezó como ayudante cobrando, lo cual ganaba menos pero logro poder ser el conductor, es un trabajo agitado ya que desde horas muy temprana sale de su casa, y da como diez vuelta en toda la capital, para poder ganar bien el día. Este es su sexto ciclo en Afodenic el cual comprara materiales de construcción para hacer más grande un cuarto y poder estar cómodo junto a su familia, pues poco a poco ha  logrado hacer las mejoras a su casa. Y su anhelo es poder algún día tener su propia unidad de transporte mediante un financiamiento. Da las gracias a la institución por aprobar el préstamo el cual comenzara con su proyecto.
texts.en:
Erick M., 29, works in an urban transportation cooperative in the capital of Managua. He started working there when he was 19. He married at an early age; he and his wife have two children. He lives in the Camilo Ortega neighborhood. When he started working he was a helper collecting fees. He earned less doing this, but he was able to become a driver. It is hectic work because he leaves his house very early and does about ten routes around the city to be able to earn well in a day. This is his sixth cycle with Afodenic. He will use the loan to buy construction materials to enlarge a room and be able to be more comfortable with his family. Little by little he has made improvements on his house. His goal is to one day be able to, through loans, have his own vehicle for transportation. He is grateful to the institution for approving the loan, which he will use to start his project.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to enlarge a room

texts.es:
La socia  es natural de Quillabamba, pero hace algunos meses radica en la ciudad el Cusco, ella pertenece al banco comunal grupo esperanza. La socia vive en santa Beatriz D-4 en Cusco.

La socia tiene 26 años de edad y es soltera, ella en la ciudad del Cusco viene trabajando como cocinera en un restaurante, nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para poder comprar algunas cosas para uso propio y poco a poco continuar juntando y ahorrando dinero para comprar sus cositas para su hogar.

La socia esta muy agradecida por el apoyo brindado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus préstamo en el tiempo programado.

texts.en:
This is Michael W. and John B. K.. They call their group N.P Squad, named after the area they sell. They are small scale businessmen in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. They have received several loans from Kiva through SMT.   They always repay their loans on time and in full. Their previous loan was for Le 1,000,000 each. This helped them a lot. They were able to make a lot of profit from the loan, thus able to solve many of their problems. Today, they are requesting a loan of Le 1,300,000 each to further add to their businesses.

Michael W. (right) is the leader of this group. Michael was born in Lunsar small town, in northern Sierra Leone. He is forty-five years of age, married and a father of seven children who are attending schools. Michael sells medicines and has been doing this business for over twenty years now.

loans.name: Marlon Antonio
