Madame Sata S. est une femme mariée qui est mère de  neuf enfants. Elle  vit avec son époux et ses enfants dans une famille nucléaire à Hérémakono,  un village situé à 25  kilomètres de Bamako (la capitale du Mali) relevant de Koulikoro deuxième région administrative de la république de Mali.
Madame Sata S. intégra le programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance de Soro Yiriwaso il y a de cela quatre ans.
Après six prêts de groupe et un prêt individuel tous remboursés sans aucune difficulté, elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel avec lequel elle désire s’approvisionner en ustensiles de cuisine pour les revendre en ambulant. 
Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako une fois par mois et  compte avoir avec ce prêt, six douzaines de qualités différentes et espère  réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 55. 000 FCFA qui sera destiné à la prise en charge des dépenses familiales et au remboursement de ses échéances.
Elle ambitionne, avec l’appui de Soro Yiriwaso et de son partenaire Kiva, effectuer des voyages sur la république de Guinée Conakry où se trouvent actuellement les meilleures qualités d’articles qu’elle vend et pour mieux servir sa clientèle croissante.
texts.en:
Ms. Sata S. is a married woman who is the mother of nine children.  She lives with her husband and children in a nuclear family in Hérémakono, a village located 25 km from Bamako (the capital of Mali) which is part of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  Ms. Sata S. joined the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso four years ago.  After six group loans and an individual loan, all repaid without a problem, she is now on her second individual loan, which she would like to use to supply herself with kitchen utensils for reselling door-to-door. She stocks up in Bamako once a month and plans on using this loan to obtain six dozen of different quality and hopes to realize an average monthly profits of 55,000 francs CFA.  The profits will be for meeting family expenses and for making loan payments.  Her ambition, with the support of Soro Yiriwaso and its partner Kiva, is to take trips to Conakry, Republic of Guinée, where the highest quality goods she sells are currently found.  She can then better serve her growing customer base.  

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
El microempresario Lorenzo C. tiene 41 años de edad, es casado, con 4 hijos que estudian en los niveles primario y secundario. El microempresario C. se dedica hace más de 10 años al oficio de soldador, realizando diversos trabajos sobre soldadura con materiales de hierro tales como verjas, cercos, etc.

Con esta actividad el señor C. ha mantenido su hogar realizando pequeños contratos con contratistas y personas naturales que lo buscan pata tales fines. Sin embargo para realizar pequeños trabajos de soldadura, los clientes no compra el material por lo que el soldador tiene que hacer ese gasto aunque es remunerado al terminar la obra.

Actualmente el microempresario C. tiene varios pequeños contratos pero no ha podido realizarlos por no contar con el material para tal fin y por la misma razón necesita se le financie para comprar lo siguiente:

6 unidades de Tubos garvan de ½ que le cuestan US 16 cada tubo, 10 unidades de varillas entorchadas que valen US 12 cada varilla, 10 unidades de varillas lisas que valen US 6 cada varilla y 8 unidades de platino de ½ que valen US 3 cada unidad.

loans.use: Comprar Tubos garvan de 1/2, varillas entorchadas, varillas lisas y platino de ½.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is fifty-six years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town.

Margaret is a food vendor. She cooks and sells rice and stew and sells on a table by a roadside in her community. She buys bags of rice and other ingredients from nearby towns.

Margaret has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice to make rice and stew

texts.fr:
Madame Sadio C. est une femme mariée, âgée de 34 ans qui vit avec ses deux enfants et ses coépouses dans une famille traditionnelle à Ouéléssébougou situé à 80 kilomètres de Bamako (la capitale du Mali) et relevant de Koulikoro,  deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali. 
Madame Sadio C. exerce plusieurs activités génératrices de revenus mais excelle beaucoup plus dans celle de la  restauration au niveau d’une gargote sise au marché de Ouéléssébougou, qui se trouve être la gare routière de la même localité. 
Après avoir correctement remboursés ses six premiers prêts (tous des prêts solidaires), elle est son septième prêt, (cette fois-ci, un prêt individuel).
Avec ce prêt individuel, elle compte acheter, 320 kilogrammes de tubercules, 200  kilogrammes de couscous d’igname séché appelé « Sado » : (une alimentation très prisée dans la sous région) qui se mange avec du poisson, et 100 kilogrammes de poisson de mer, qui seront préparés  en différents plats alimentaires avant d’être revendus. 
Elle s’approvisionne deux fois par mois à Bamako et vend sur place au marché dans sa gargote et devant les établissements scolaires à une étale à une clientèle riche et variée.
Elle compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 110.000 FCFA qui servira à payer les échéances du prêt, subvenir aux dépenses de sa famille et réinvestir dans son entreprise.

texts.en:
Grace A. is fifty years old. She is married and has give birth to four children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town.

Grace is a trader. She trades in foodstuffs such as plantain. She sells at the local market and supplies to retailers and food vendors in her community. She also trades in palm oil production. She buys her goods from nearby towns.

Grace has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy plantain in bulk to expand her business.

texts.fr: Koku T. est un homme âgé de 61 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants. Il habite à Kpadapé, un village situé à 10 kilomètres de Kpalimé. C’est un enseignant retraité. Avec ce crédit, il estimerait achever sa maison afin de ne plus payer les frais de location. Il compte sur cette opportunité pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Koku T. is 61 years old, married and father of four children. He lives in Kpadapé, a village located about 10 kilometers from Kpalimé. He is a retired teacher. With this loan, Mr T. hopes to finish building his house in order to stop paying rental costs. He is counting on this opportunity to improve his family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
El socio Enrrique, pertenece al banco comunal, líderes del tercer milenio, nuestro socio vive en la misma ciudad del Cusco.

El socio tiene  52 años de edad,  es soltero y se dedica a muchas actividades pero entre la principal y la que le ha dado logros y beneficios económicos es la venta y  distribución de  libros, nuestro socio lleva a ofrecer sus diversos libros por casas, instituciones y demás lugares dónde la gente se interese en la compra de algún ejemplar y los deja a cuotas, de modo tal que mensualmente él vuelva para cobrar las cuotas hasta que estas se cancelen, nuestro socio requiere el préstamo para adquirir algunos nuevos libros y también para uso personal, cubriendo sus cuotas con su trabajo de distribución de libros.

Nuestro socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our partner, Enrrique, belongs to the communal bank "Líderes del Tercer Milenio" and lives in the city of Cusco. He is 52 years old, single, and makes a living through many activities. The activity that has brought him the most success and economic benefit is the sale and distribution of books. Our partner offers a diverse range of books in houses, institutions, and other places where people are interested in buying books. He collects payments in monthly installments until they are paid off. He needs this loan to acquire new books and also for personal use, covering his payments with his book distribution job. Our partner is thankful for and values the loan granted to him and is committed to follow through with his payments in the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

This is Hawa C., Emma K. and Kadiatu S.. They call their group Yeliboya. They are small-scale entrepreneurs in Magburaka town, in northern Sierra Leone. This will be the fourth loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva Lenders. Previous loans have helped these entrepreneurs’ businesses and personal lives a great deal.  Having completed repaying their last loan successfully, they are again asking for a new loan of Le 1,000,000 for each to help them further strengthen their businesses. 

Hawa C. on the right is the leader of this group. Hawa was born in Freetown about fifty-five years ago. She now lives in Magburaka town, where she is married together with her five children. Two of Hawa’s children are already grown-ups, one is in college and two are in secondary schools. Hawa sells dried fish which she buys from a village called Yeliboya. She has been in the dried fish business for over eighteen years now.

texts.fr: Cette dame est mariée et mère de 02 enfants, son mari est un militaire , le revenu de ce dernier est insuffisant pour couvrir les charges du foyer, c’est pour aider ce dernier dans les charges de la famille qu’elle a démarré le commerce de maïs. Voulant se réapprovisionner pour augmenter ses recettes, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 30 sacs de maïs.

loans.name: Yirtankaka

texts.fr: Cette femme est divorcée de son époux et a à sa seule charge son enfant, pour subvenir à ses propres besoins et à celle de son enfant elle a entamé en 2005, le commerce de sacs de charbons de bois. Elle veut augmenter son stock pour vendre plus et assurer les charges de la rentrée scolaire de son enfant, elle sollicite donc un crédit pour acheter 200 sacs de charbons de bois.

loans.use: Achat de sacs de charbon de bois

texts.es: La señora Karen T. Narváez se dedica a ofrecer los servicios de salón de belleza. Ella tiene 1 hijo menor que está a su cargo, sus esfuerzos de sacar a su hijos adelante es su prioridad  por lo que fue su motivación con este negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es un lugar donde es muy transitado por muchos clientes. Ella inicio a este negocio debido a la necesidad de mantenerse porque buscaba trabajo y no encontraba, y con mucho sacrificio tenía que encontrar la forma de establecer su propio negocio y comenzó con la compra de una secadora y una plancha para el pelo y ofrecer muy buenos servicios por lo que así logro dedicarse obteniendo muy buenos resultados. El crédito será invertido en la compra de mercaderías tales como tintes, mascarillas, etc., además que desea realizarles algunas mejoras al local del negocio. Ella posee el sueño de mejorar las condiciones del negocio, para mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y de su hijo, que permitan brindarle una buena educación.

loans.name: Fé Y Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Fé y Esperanza, se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad de Churcampa, distrito y provincia D. mismo nombre, ubicado en el departamento de Huancavelica. La comunidad de Churcampa de encuentra ubicado a 03 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho, caracterizándose por su producción agropecuaria.

Dionicia, es viuda y tiene 01 hijo. Dionicia desde muy joven se dedica a los negocios, por ahora a la compra y venta de animales menores en las ferias, negocio en el cual le ayuda su hijo. Dionicia, solicita un préstamo con el cual compraría mas animales para su venta. Dionicia, esta ahorrando para contar con su propio capital y para la educación de su único hijo.

Gregoria, es madre soltera y tiene 03 hijos. Gregoria se dedica a la venta de comida, tanto en las ferias como en su comunidad, donde da pensión a los lugareños. Gregoria quiere abastecer e implementar su pequeño restaurante, por lo que solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos y materiales, con los cuales mejorar su negocio.

loans.use: El Bancomunal Fé y Esperanza solicita un préstamo de 9,400 soles para que sus 19 socias inviertan en sus negocios

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Résidente du quartier d’agoè-atsanvé, cette femme dynamique a commencé en 2006, le commerce d’huiles de palme, son ancienneté dans ce commerce a fait qu’elle en a la parfaite maîtrise, mariée et mère de 03 enfants, c’est avec le revenu de ce commerce qu’elle subvient aux charges de la famille. Faisant face actuellement à une baisse de son stock, elle souhaite se réapprovisionner et sollicite par conséquent de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 15 bidons d’huiles de palme.
texts.en:
A resident of the neighborhood of Agoè-Atsanvé, this dynamic woman started her palm oil business in 2006. WIth her experience in this business, she has attained perfect mastery. She is married and the mother of 3 children. Income from this business enables her to provides for her family's needs. Her stock has decreased and she wishes to restock it - as such, she is requesting a loan from WAGES (a micro-finance organization), in order to buy 15 cans of palm oil.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cans of palm oil

texts.en:
This is Issa T., Abu Bakarr B., Abdulai F., Abu K. and Kaday Y..  They are small scale businesspeople in Magburaka town, in northern Sierra Leone. They call their group Kamuyusu, a Temne phrase meaning “Be Patient with us”. This is the first loan they are getting from SMT/Kiva. They are requesting a loan of Le 500,000 for each. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit, and improve their standard of living.

Issa T. (left) is the leader of this group. Issa was born in Mayolo village, an outskirt of Magburaka town. He is thirty-five years of age, married to a businesswoman and they have two children – one in class three and the other in class two. Issa sells sneakers, tooth brush, tooth pastes, and medicines. Issa has been a businessman for over fifteen years now. He will invest this loan into his business by buying more of the goods he sells.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a member of the Lord of Cachuy village bank.  She is 27 years-old, married, and has two children.  The children, ages 9 and 10, are both studying in the public school. 

Patricia did not finish school because she became pregnant, and was then married.  After some time, she began to work for a friend who had a business with a market stand.  Since her friend frequently traveled to Spain, she sold her stand to Patricia.  Patricia started off month by month, growing little by little, and slowly supplied her business.  

Through FINCA Peru, Patricia has learned to be punctual, responsible with her payments, and she has learned to invest her money.  Patricia needs a loan of 800 Soles to buy backpacks and other items for her stand.  Her dream is that her small business grows to become a large business.

loans.use: Purchase backpacks and items for her stand

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Lord of Cachuy village bank. 
Rosa is a single mother that has two children who are 19 and 9. Her oldest child studies in an institute and the youngest goes to public school. 
Rosa worked as a secretary for a business for 15 years. She quit because she wanted to be bear her children and she wanted to be independent. She bought cabinets and a showcase to start a convenience store in her house. With FINCA Peru, Rosa has learned to save, invest, and the loans have been of great help because she is both mother and father to her children. 
Rosa needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy groceries, rice, sugar, and beer. Her dream is to grow her business and be a wholesaler.

loans.use: buy groceries, rice, sugar, and beer

loans.name: Chantal

texts.fr: A. Chantal est née vers les année 1966 à Agonli. Chantal est mariée à DOVIDE Pierre. Chantal est mère de 4 enfants tous scolarisés. La famille réside à Suru–Léré un quartier de Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Chantal vend depuis les années 2000 de charbon de bois et de boissons liqueurs produit localement. Mais depuis 2003, Chantal a associé à ces activités la vente de gravier. Mais, Chantal fait cette activité avec son mari. Chantal a déjà eu trois crédits d’ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu élever le niveau de son activité. Pour  continuer à développer son activité, Chantal demande un quatrième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.

loans.use: Achat de gravier et de sacs de charbon de bois.

loans.name: Faïdatou

texts.fr: Cette femme s’est spécialisée dans la vente de bazins et de foulards de qualité venant du Mali. Elle est mariée à un conducteur de taxi, et le couple a 03 enfants. C’est une vendeuse ambulante dans le quartier d’Agoè Atsamé à Lomé ; elle a débuté cette activité en 2007 et ceci lui permet d’apporter sa contribution financière dans la vie du foyer. Elle reçoit donc ses commandes du Mali où elle revend très souvent ses bazins et foulards pour les femmes musulmanes non seulement de son quartier mais aussi d’autres quartiers périphériques de Lomé. Beaucoup de ses clients apprécient la qualité de ses produits. Actuellement elle a besoin de lancer de nouvelles commandes ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 11 bals de bazins et 125 foulards.

loans.use: Achat de bals de bazins et des foulards

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is a member of the Lord of Cachuy village bank. 
She is 75 years-old, married, and has eight children. She has a 53 year-old that got meningitis when he was a kid which impaired him so that he was not able to study. 
Jacinta is from Junin and arrived in Lima when she was 13 years ago and started to work during the day and went to school in the evenings until she got married and decided to take care of her eight children. Over the years her children matured and got married, but the household economy got worse. Twelve years ago she decided to work selling clothes and now she has her own stand where she sells clothes. 
FINCA Peru gave her the opportunity to develop and thanks to the loans she is able to buy a variety of clothes, which allows her to have more sales.   
Jacinta needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy clothes such as sweaters, jackets, and wool clothes because it is still cold in Lima. Her dream is that her business grows since she wants to continue to work.

loans.use: buy clothes such as sweaters, jackets, and wool clothes because it is still cold in Lima

loans.name: Kossiwa Natewyéné

texts.fr: Cette dame est spécialisée dans la vente d’une bouillie très appréciée de la population dénommée « akloui zogbon ». Elle a débuté ce commerce depuis 1995. Son mari est professeur de CEG et cela lui permet d’apporter sa contribution financière dans la vie du foyer. Grâce à son mari, elle pu trouver une place dans l’enceinte du collège, ce qui lui permet de vendre sa bouillie aux élèves. Elle est la seule à vendre de la bouillie « akloui zogbon » ; elle vend aussi des beignets accompagnant sa bouillie. Actuellement elle a besoin de constituer des stocks pour continuer ses activités ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 03 sacs de maïs et 4 sacs de farine de blé. Elle est mère de 02 enfants.

loans.use: Achat de sacs de maïs et de farine de blés

texts.es:
Este socio se llama Alberto, él es natural de Sicuani situada a 3 horas de la ciudad del Cusco, pero desde ya buenos años el socio radica en la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio tiene 54 años de edad, el es casado y tienen 2 hijos, nuestro socio alterna sus diferentes actividades con la  pasamanería  y también es fotógrafo. Nuestro socio se encarga de fotografiar todo tipo de eventos, y también de todo el proceso de la decoración, nuestro socio utilizará el crédito para reinvertir en su pequeña empresa.

Nuestro socio esta muy agradecido por el apoyo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member is called Alberto. He is a native of Sicuani, situated 3 hours from the city of Cusco, but for years he has been established in Cusco.

Our member divides his time between a shop selling ornamental trimming for clothing and his work as a photographer. Our member employs himself photographing all types of events and also in the entire process of decoration. Our member will use the loan to reinvest in his small business. He is very grateful for the support granted by means of this loan and promises to make payments according to the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Kokou-Tolidji

texts.fr: Ce Monsieur est revendeur de friperie dans le quartier d’Adidogomé à Lomé ; il est marié et a 03 enfants à sa charge. Cette activité lui permet donc de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Il a débuté ce commerce depuis 2000 ; il maîtrise donc parfaitement son secteur. Il vend ses vêtements dans le marché d’Adidogomé où il est très connu de beaucoup de clients. Il revend même ses vêtements à d’autres femmes qui sont des revendeuses ambulantes. Actuellement il a besoin de renouveler son stock ; c’est pour cette raison qu’il sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 03 bals de friperie dans le marché de Hédzranawoé à Lomé. Il compte sur sa maîtrise du marché pour vite rembourser ce prêt.
texts.en:
This gentleman sells second-hand clothing in the neighborhood of Adidogomé in Lomé. He is married and financially responsible for three children. This business allows him to provide for his family's needs.

He began this trade in 2000, so he is well versed in his line of business. He sells clothing at the market of Adidogomé where he is well known from a lot of people. He even resells his clothing to other women who are walking saleswomen. Currently, he needs to renew his stock. For this reason he is asking for a loan from WAGES to buy 3 bales of second-hand clothing at the market of Hédzranawoé in Lomé. He is relying upon his mastery of the market to reimburse this loan quickly.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bales of second-hand clothing

texts.fr: Cette jeune dame est une vendeuse ambulante de pagnes de diverses qualités ; elle habite le quartier d’Adidogomé à Lomé ; elle a débuté cette activité en 2007. Ce commerce lui permet surtout de se prendre en charge et donc, de subvenir à ses besoins de base. Elle est bien connue de biens de femmes habitant non seulement son quartier mais aussi des femmes d’autres quartiers. Elle accepte même parfois de vendre à crédit pour ne pas perdre certaines de ses clientes qui ne peuvent payer immédiatement. Actuellement elle a besoin d’acheter des pagnes au Grand Marché de Lomé, mais aussi dans le marché de Kpalimé à quelques dizaines de kilomètres de Lomé. C’est pour cette raison qu’elle voudrait avoir un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 20 pagnes de qualité Super Wax, 15 pagnes Soso et 25 pagnes Bogolan. Elle est célibataire et sans enfant.

Kokouvi A. est un homme âgé de 40 ans, marié et père de 8 enfants. Il habite à Womé, un village situé à 12 kilomètres de Kpalimé. C’est un revendeur de café et cacao. Son activité consiste à acheter du café et cacao auprès des agriculteurs et les revendre aux exportateurs internationaux. Avec ce prêt, Kokouvi voudrait augmenter la capacité de son commerce en achetant beaucoup de café et cacao afin de satisfaire sa clientèle. Avec ces bénéfices, il espérait bien s’occuper de la santé et de la scolarisation  de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Kokouvi A. is 40 years old, married and father of eight children. He lives in Womé, a village located about 12 kilometers from Kpalimé. He sells coffee and cocoa. His business activity involves buying coffee and cocoa from farmers and reselling it to international exporters. Mr A. would like to use this loan to increase his trading capacity by purchasing large amounts of coffee and cocoa to satisfy his clientele. He hopes to use the profit to pay for health care and schooling for his children.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Nuestro socio se llama Genaro, este socio pertenece al banco comunal, líderes del tercer milenio, nuestro socio es natural de Iscuchaka en el distrito de Anta, y reside en la misma ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio tiene 39 años de edad, es soltero y alterna sus actividades con el comercio minorista, nuestro socio vende libros en ferias, casa, instituciones  y las da tanto al crédito como al contado, este viene siendo su trabajo formal y ya lleva muchos años con este negocio. Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para reinvertir en su negocio y parte de ello hacer uso personal.

Nuestro socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Genaro belongs to the community bank 'Lideres del tercer milenio' (leaders of the third millenium). He comes from Iscuchaka in the district of Anta, and lives in the city of Cusco. Genaro is 39 years of age, single and as well as being a commercial retailer, he also sells books for cash and credit in fairs, institutions and his own house. This is his formal occupation and he has spent many years in this profession. He is applying for a loan to reinvest in his business and to use part of it for personal use. Genaro is thankful for this valuable loan and is committed to making his repayments at the allocated times.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal VilL. Pachamarca, se encuentra ubicado en L. comunidad D. Pachamarca, distrito del mismo nombre, provincia D. Churcampa, departamento D. Huancavelica. Esta comunidad se caracteriza por L. producción D. cereales como el maíz, trigo, cebada, así como frutos, como naranjas, papayas y otros.

Marcelina es divorciada y tiene 01 hijo. Marcelina, se dedica a L. crianza y venta D. animales menores, los cuales venD. en las minas y en L. ciudad D. Huancayo, con L. ayuda D. su hijo. Marcelina requiere D. un préstamo, con el cual comprará mas animales para su venta. ElL., está ahorrando para L. educación D. su hijo.

Miriam, es casada y tiene 04 hijos. ElL. se dedica a L. venta D. diversos productos en su pequeña bodega, así como a L. venta D. animales menores. ElL., se abastece D. productos en L. ciudad D. Huancayo, para lo que requiere un préstamo, así como para habilitar una pequeña granja para sus animales. Miriam, piensa en el futuro D. sus hijos, para lo cual ya se encuentra ahorrando, ya que le gustaría que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The VilL. Pachamarca Communal Bank is located in the Pachamarca community in the district with the same name, Churcampa province, Huancavelica department. This community is characterized by grain production such as corn, wheat, and barley. Oranges, papayas, and other fruits are also grown. Marcelina is divorced and has one child. Marcelina raises and sells small animals. She sells them, with help from her son, in the mines in the city of Huancay. Marcelina needs a loan to buy more animals to sell. She is saving for her son’s education. Miriam is married and has four children. She sells diverse products in her convenience store. She also sells small animals. She stocks up on products in the city of Huancayo. She needs a loan to set up a small farm for her animals. Miraim, thinking of her children’s future, is already saving. She would like them to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée et est mère de 03 enfants. Son mari est un conducteur de taxi ; c’est parce que les revenus financiers de son mari n’arrivent plus à couvrir tous les besoins du  foyer que cette femme a pris la décision en 2005  de se lancer dans la vente de pagnes et de certains articles scolaires, plus précisément les cahiers. Cette activité lui permet désormais d’apporter son aide financière à son mari pour l’éducation scolaire de leurs enfants. Elle est connue des femmes de son quartier Awatamé à Lomé, qui viennent acheter des pagnes de qualité chez elle ; c’est pour s’approvionner au Grand Marché de Lomé qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 10 pagnes Super Wax, 10 pagnes Soso et des cahiers de 200 et 100 pages. Elle n’a aucune inquiétude pour le remboursement à temps du prêt.
texts.en:
This woman is married and has three children. Her husband is a taxi driver; it was because her husband's income was unable to cover all of the household expenses that this woman decided in 2005 to start a business selling pagnes (a type of West African cloth) and certain school items, specifically notebooks. This business has allowed her to support her husband financially in the education of their children. She is well known among the women of her district, Awatamé, in Lomé; these women come to buy high quality pagnes at her house. It is to supply herself at the Grand Market in Lomé that she is seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to buy 10 Super Wax pagnes, 10 Soso pagnes, and 100- and 200-page notebooks. She has no worries about the timely repayment of this loan.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pagnes (a type of West African cloth) and notebooks

texts.es: Zoila Carmensa S. S. ella es una persona muy activa que disfruta mucho de su trabajo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 9 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Por lo que tiene 6 hijos de los cuales ninguno depende de ella ya que todos trabajan de manera independiente, la ubicación de su negocio es en su misma casa de habitación, por lo que ha modificado ciertas partes de su vivienda para que sus clientes puedan apreciar sus productos, por lo que ha obtenido clientes por su gran carisma. Actualmente recurre a Fundación León 2000 para invertir en la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, ropa interior, cremas y calzado que es muy solicitado por sus clientes que son hombres. Su deseo es seguir adelante con este negocio.

texts.fr: Cet homme a fini ses études à l’université mais il n’a pas eu la chance de trouver un emploi. Il est marié et est père de 03 enfants. Sa femme est une revendeuse dont les revenus n’arrivent plus à couvrir tous les besoins du foyer ; c’est pour cette raison qu’il a pris la décision en 2000 de se lancer dans le commerce de charbon de bois très souvent réservé aux femmes. Il exerce ce commerce dans le quartier de Saint-Joseph à Lomé. Cette activité lui permet désormais de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Il réalise de bonnes affaires ces temps-ci et est fier de cette activité génératrice de revenus. Il a besoin d’acheter de nouveaux sacs ; c’est pour cette raison qu’il sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 15 sacs de charbons de bois. Il compte sur sa bonne foi et sa meilleure connaissance de son marché pour rembourser le prêt dans les délais exigés.
texts.en:
This man finished his university studies but was not able to find a job. He is married and has three children. His wife is a retailer whose income is no longer able to cover the household expenses; it is for this reason that he decided in 2000 to start a business selling charcoal, something normally conducted by women. He runs this business in the Saint-Joseph district in Lomé. This business has allowed him to provide for his family. He enjoys good business these days and is proud of his income-generating activity. Currently, he needs to buy new bags; it is for this reason that he is seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to buy 15 bags of charcoal. He is confident that his good faith and excellent knowledge of his market will allow him to repay this loan within the allotted time.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
El socio Percy, pertenece al banco comunal, líderes del tercer milenio, nuestro socio es natural de la ciudad de Puno, y reside en ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio tiene 33 años de edad, es soltero, y nuestro socio alterna sus otras actividades con la que es la principal el comercio minorista, el socio confecciona prendas de vestir. Él trabaja en esto como parte de una pasión, hace trajes de vestir para varones y mujeres, por lo que el socio solicita el préstamo para reinvertir en su negocio, parte de ello el utilizará para uso personal.

Nuestro socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deuda en el tiempo establecido.

texts.fr: Ce jeune homme est un informaticien ; il n’est pas marié et n’a pas non plus aucun enfant à sa charge. Il n’a pas pu trouver un emploi à son goût pour se prendre en charge. C’est pour cette raison qu’il a pris la décision l’année dernière d’ouvrir son propre cyber café dans le quartier de Cassanblaca à Lomé. Cette activité lui permet désormais de subvenir à ses besoins ; il gère lui-même le cyber pour le moment mais compte recruter une jeune fille dans l’avenir. Il pense donc acquérir de nouvelles machines ; c’est pour cela qu’il voudrait avoir un crédit de WAGES pour acheter au moins 03 ordinateurs ; le reste du prêt servira à acheter des fils et câbles d’alimentation. Il est persuadé que ce prêt apportera un grand changement dans ses activités.

Cette dame s’est spécialisée dans un commerce d’un genre particulier : la vente de perles traditionnelles. Elle a débuté ce commerce en 2005 dans son quartier d’Adidogomé à Lomé. Cette activité lui permet entres autres de subvenir à tous ses besoins. Elle sillonne plusieurs villages et localités du Togo à la recherche de ces perles traditionnelles, rares de nos jours. Elle s’approvisionne aussi au Ghana, au Mali, au Niger et au Burkina faso. Elle vend le plus souvent à des touristes européens et américains en visite au Togo ; elle a des contrats avec des jeunes démarcheurs qui amènent ces touristes à son domicile ; elle achète les perles et assure elle-même le montage. Elle a besoin d’effectuer certains achats nécessaires ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter des fils et commander d’autres perles en quantité. Elle est célibataire et sans enfant.
texts.en:
This woman specializes in an unusual business: the sale of traditional pearls. She began this business in 2005 in the Adidogomé district of Lomé. This business allows her, among other things, to provide for her family. She criss-crosses through many villages and areas in Togo searching for these traditional pearls, which are rare these days. She also supplies herself in Ghana, Mali, Niger, and Burkina Faso. She sells her goods most often to European and American tourists visiting Togo; she has contracts with young salesmen who bring these tourists to her house; she buys the pearls and sets them herself. She currently needs to purchase certain items; it is for this reason that she is seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to buy thread and to order more pearls in bulk. She is unmarried and has no children.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
El socio Jose, pertenece al banco comunal, líderes del tercer milenio, nuestro socio es natural de la ciudad de Cusco.

Nuestro socio tiene 40 años de edad vive en el barrio de Manuel prado, es conviviente y tiene  2 hijos, nuestro socio alterna sus actividades con la prestación de servicios hoteleros, el trabaja en un hotel en el área de house keeping o ama de llaves en español, nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para uso personal, el necesita pagar algunas deudas y adquirir algunos muebles y el colegio de los hijos, por lo que requiere el préstamo.

Nuestro socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y se compromete en cumplir con el pago estipulado en el contrato.

texts.en:
Here are members of the group called “Confidence”. They are small-scale businesspeople in Magburaka town, in northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of Le 500,000 each for the very first time to enable them improve on the quality and sizes of their businesses. With a lot of goods in their stalls, they will be able to attract a lot of customers to their businesses, make more sales and increase their profit. Consequently, they will be able to better look after themselves and their children.

Marie F. (left) is the leader of this group. Marie was born in Magburaka town. She is age thirty-four and is a widow with three children – one in class VI, another in class V and the last in class II.

Marie sells shoes, cigarettes, milk, sardines, biscuits (cookies), mints, etc., and has been a businesswoman for over eight years now. With this loan, she will be able to expand her business, make more sales and better profit. In this way, she can better look after her children as a single parent.

texts.es:
La socia se llama Graciela, pertenece al banco comunal, líderes del tercer milenio, nuestro socio es natural de la ciudad de Cusco.

La socia alterna sus diferentes actividades tanto del hogar como otras manualidades, con la venta de ropa, nuestra socia es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos, ella es padre y madre apara sus hijos, por lo que es una mujer muy fuerte y abnegada, nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para poder reinvertir en su pequeño negocio.

La socia agradece el préstamo y valora el apoyo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bales of second-hand clothing for resale

texts.es:
El socio es el Sr. Leon, pertenece al banco comunal, líderes del tercer milenio, nuestro socio es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio tiene 55 años de edad, es soltero, no tiene hijos y vive en el distrito de santiago, nuestro socio como un buen grupo de sus compañeros de dedican a la venta de libros, este socio tiene su pequeño stand y vende libros, motivo por el cual requiere el préstamo para poder reinvertir en su pequeño negocio.

Nuestro socio agradece y valora el préstamo para mejorar su calidad de vida y abastecerse más de libros, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
The partner is Mr. Leon and he belongs to the community bank, “Leaders of the Third Millennium.” Our partner is a native of the city of Cusco. He is 55 years old, single, and without children. He lives in the district of Santiago. This partner, along with a good group of his friends, sells books. He has a small stand where he sells books, and for this reason he needs a loan to be able to reinvest in his small business. He is grateful and values the loan which will allow him to improve his quality of like and supply more books. He is committed to completing his loan payments in the established time.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

This is Marie B., Yeabu K. and Marie S.. They are local entrepreneurs in Magburaka town. They called their group United Traders. They are requesting a loan of Le 500,000 for each. This is the first loan this group is accessing from SMT/Kiva. With the help of this loan, they will be able to improve their businesses by adding more goods into their stalls. This will attract many customers into their businesses; sales and profit will improve for these entrepreneurs. Consequently, the living standard of these entrepreneurs will also improve. 

Marie B. (left) is the leader of this group. She was born in a small town call Mile Ninety-One, in northern Sierra Leone. She is age twenty-nine, married to a teacher and the two of them have four children. Two of her children are in class four, one in class three and the other is in nursery school. Marie sells ground-nuts/peanuts; rice and other locally produce goods. Marie also sells shoes. She has been a businesswoman for five years now.

Here are members of the Arsenal group. They named their group after the name of their favorite European football club, Arsenal.  They are small scale businesswomen in Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT/Kiva to seek a loan of Le 500,000 for each for the very first time to enable them improve their businesses. With such a loan, they will be able to expand their businesses both in size and quality. In this way, they can make more sales and better profit. Consequently, their living standards will improve – they will be able to better support their school going children in terms of feeding, clothing and meeting schools expenses. 

Marie C. (left) is the leader of this group. Marie was born in a village about three miles from Magburaka town. She is now thirty-two years old. She is married to a motor-driver and they have three children. Two of Marie’s children are attending primary schools and the last is still sucking. Marie sells cigarettes, biscuits, cans of milk, candles, etc.  She has been a businesswoman for many years now. Marie wants to use this loan to buy cosmetics from Freetown and sells in Magburaka town.

The above are members of the Wake-up Traders’ group. Small-scale businesspeople in the town of Magburaka, located in northern Sierra Leone, they are requesting a loan of Le 500,000 each to enable them to improve their businesses. With a loan, they will be able to carry more goods in their stalls, make more sales and earn greater profits. Consequently, their living standard will improve so that they can better look after themselves and their children.

The leader of this group is Fatmata N. (on the left in the photo), born in the village of Blama in eastern Sierra Leone but now living with her husband and three children in Magburaka. Her husband is a businessman, while two of her children are attending secondary schools and the eldest is a nurse. For many years now, Fatmata has sold local goods such as palm-kernels, bananas, palm-oil, etc.

Here are Memuna C., Emmanuel G. and Mariatu J.. They are members of the Kargbo United group. This will be the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. They have been in business for many years now but business has been developing at a very slow pace. They have thus come to SMT/Kiva to seek a loan of Le 500,000 for each to help them improve their businesses. 

Memuna C. (left) is the leader of this group. Memuna was born in Magburaka town, twenty-eight years ago. She is married with two children who are attending schools. Memuna has been a businesswoman for five years now. She sells ground-nut (peanuts) and palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil). She will invest this loan into her business, makes more profit and improves her standard of living.

Above are Delvin A. S. and Kadiatu C., who named their group Good Never Done. Previous loans from SMT/Kiva have made meaningful contributions towards the development and well being of these entrepreneurs, enabling them to expand their businesses, make better sales and earn greater profits. Consequently, their standards of living have improved. Having fully repaid their previous loan, they are now requesting a new loan of Le 800,000 each to further strengthen their businesses.

Delvin A. S. (on the left in the photo), the leader of this group, was born in Magburaka, Tonkolili district, in northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a businesswoman and they have four children, one in Junior Secondary School I, two in primary schools, and the fourth not yet of school-going age. Delvin and his wife have sold cosmetics and jewelry in the town’s main market for over ten years now. With previous SMT/Kiva loans, Delvin’s business has grown to the point that he has been able to build himself a small shop at the market.

texts.es:
La socia se llama Shirley, pertenece al banco comunal, líderes del tercer milenio, nuestro socio es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 33 años de edad, la socia tiene 1 hijo y es madre soltera, ella alterna sus diferentes actividades con el comercio minorista, ella vende carteras sombreros con esta dinero y a mucho esfuerzo nuestra socia saca adelante a sus hijo y es padre y madre para el, la socia también logró tener un  carro y lo puso a trabajar como servicio de taxi, nuestra socia es una mujer muy luchadora y sumamente trabajadora, por lo que cada idea de negocio que ella pone en su mente le es fructífera. La socia desea el préstamo para reinvertir y comprar mercadería y para uso personal.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado comprometiéndose a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado en el contrato.

loans.name: Clarisse

texts.fr: Y. Clarisse est née vers 1982 à Ouidah. Clarisse est mariée à LISSANOU Ghislaine, un employé du plus grand hôpital du Bénin. Clarisse est mère de trois enfants et en plus de leurs enfants, son mari et elle ont à charge deux autres enfants, tous scolarisés. La famille vit à Fridjrossè  à Cotonou, Capitale Economique  de la République du Bénin. Grâce au revenu de son activité, Clarisse vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. C’est des mèches et des produits  cosmétiques que Clarisse vend. C’est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Clarisse achète ses produits. Clarisse a déjà trois ans d’expérience dans cette activité.  Clarisse a déjà eu deux crédits d’ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu élever le niveau de son activité.  Pour  continuer de développer son activité, Clarisse demande un troisième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.

loans.use: Achat de mèches et de produits cosmétiques.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra: Rosa, pertenece al banco comunal, líderes del tercer milenio, nuestro socio es natural de la ciudad de Apurimac, pero reside en la ciudad de Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 31 años de edad, la socia es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, ella alterna sus diferentes actividades con el trabajo de secretariado, ella trabaja de secretaria  en la distribuidora fénix, nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para poder hacer uso personal de este dinero, en cuanto a unos pagos que ella adquirió.

Nuestra socia agradece el préstamo otorgado por este medio y se compromete en cumplir con el pago establecido.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa belongs to the community bank called “Leaders of the Third Millennium”. This community bank is located in Apurimac. Mrs. Rosa lives in Cusco. This member is 31 years old; she has a partner and two children. She alternates between several work activities. She works as a secretary for Phoenix Distributors. She is asking for a personal loan. She is willing to take on the payments. This member is appreciative of the opportunity to have the loan and promises to make the required payments.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

She is an entrepreneur engaged in an ambulatory business. She has survived many problems including shortages of capital and low inventory, illness, low sales, and even an accident while traveling. The business requires that she and her employees wake up well before dawn and travel to the town whose market day it is, set up their display and then serve the customers until long past sundown. Then they have to pack up everything again and travel home, only to follow the same routine the next day. But she persists because she believes that with determination, patience, good customer relations, and honesty in all her dealings, she will be able to achieve her life's goal of supporting her family and providing her children with a secure future away from poverty.

This is the life of Delia C., a 57-year-old married woman with four children. The oldest now has a family while the rest still live at home and help their parents in the business. She and her husband decided to go into this business because of its income potential. Delia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon because she knew that she could borrow the capital she needed to start her business without securing the loan with a piece of property or other asset for collateral. At first she only sold small items from her home, but as time went by, her good credit record allowed her to borrow more and this enabled her to buy stocks in bigger bulks. At that point she started to go to different towns to sell her wares on their market days. She also began to employ some people to help her.

In her nine years of running this business, Delia's loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon have been the catalyst that have allowed her to expand and make more plans to widen her territory. At present this business nets a monthly profit of PHP 9,000 which helps pay for her family's household expenses. In her 16th loan cycle she borrowed PHP 15,000 to help her maintain a certain stock volume of the wares she sells. This loan was fully paid on time without any delays in the weekly repayment. Now she is borrowing PHP 14,000 for her 17th loan cycle and she will again use this money as additional working capital for her business.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few but of thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a mere $1 a day to achieving realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.name: Yabom's Group

texts.en: Yabom B. is 36 years old and has 3 children ages 13, 17, and 19.  She is married to a former sea farer who is now retired leaving her as the sole bread winner for her family.  Yabom owns a general store which sells palm oil, beans, rice, and other food products.  Yabom built her business progressively over 18 years of hard work. Today, in addition to selling to local clients in Dove Court, Yabom has secured a contract to supply food to the military.  She believes that her seriousness has enabled her to expand her store over the years.  Yabom plans to use this loan to restock and add to her inventory and hopes to be able to finance her eldest son's schooling should he gain entrance to the university.  This loan will be her first with the Association for Rural Development.

loans.use: To restock food for her store

texts.es: Las señoras Bordadoras acudieron a la Instituciòn ASDIR para poder ayudarlas para tener mejores ingresos ya que ellas se han dedicado a trabajar en bordados de guipiles a mano y esto les han servido como mantener a su familia y a ellas mismas, durante los  5 años que han venido trabajando se han dado cuenta que necesditan màs capital para poder inventir y tener màs ventas en los guipiles bordados  pero ellas no cuentan con ese fondo, ya que el lugar donde vivien es de zona de pobreza, por lo tanto a cuden a peder ayuda para ser conpetitivas en el mercado y asi tener una mejor nivel de vida; y  sacar a sus hijos  avantes y con estudios.
texts.en:
The Bordadoras ladies have come to the Institución ASDIR to be able to get help to have better incomes. They embroider “guipiles” (traditional Mayan blouses) by hand. This has supported them and their families. During the five years that they have been working they have realized that they need more capital to be able to invest and to sell more of the embroidered “guipiles”. They do not have the money. The place where they live is an area of poverty. That is why they come to ask for help to be more competitive in the market. That way they will have a better level of live and get their children ahead with their education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
La señora Yasmina G. posee su propio negocio de pulpería en su establecimiento en el departamento de Chinandega específicamente en el municipio El Viejo donde ofrece todo tipo de productos comestibles.

Ella ha venido desarrollando poco a poco su negocio logrando satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes pero con mucha necesidad de invertir en dicho negocio para desarrollarlo y es por esta razón que ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los productos y de esta manera continuar en su negocio.
texts.en:
Yasmina G. has her own mini market in the Chinandega department, specifically in the El Viejo municipality. She sells all types of food products. She has been developing her business little by little. She has been able to meet her customers’ needs, but she really needs to invest in the business to develop it. That is the reason she has come to Ceprodel to ask for a loan. The loan is to buy products and continue in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Alice

texts.fr: A. Alice est née vers 1948 à Abomey. Alice est mère de quatre  enfants.  Alice vit à Fridjrossè  à Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Grâce au revenu de son activité, Alice survient à ses besoins.  C’est du charbon de bois que Alice vend chez elle à domicile. Alice achète ses produits auprès des camionneurs. Alice est une cliente d’ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Alice a besoin de plus de moyens financiers qu’elle n’en possède pour augmenter la quantité de son stock de charbon de bois. C’est la raison pour laquelle Alice demande de crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
Alice A. was born around 1948 in Abomey. Alice is the mother of four children. Alice lives in Fridjrossè in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. Thanks to the income from her business, Alice is able to provide for herself. Alice sells charcoal at her house. Alice buys her products from haulers. Alice is a client of ALIDE (one of Kiva's field partners) who has always repaid her loans without incident. Alice needs greater financial means than what she possesses in order to increase her stock of charcoal. It is for this reason that Alice is seeking a loan to strengthen her working capital.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal for resale

texts.es:
El señor Felix G. se dedica arduamente a laborar en el municipio de El Viejo con el propósito de llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación e invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción porque requiere invertir en la vivienda ya que está dañada y necesita brindarle buenas condiciones de vida a sus hijos.

Es por este motivo que sin dudar ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de dichos materiales de construcción y así brindarle un techo digno donde habitar a su familia.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn A. is a business-minded and hardworking person who dreams of providing a better future for her family. She is 35 years old, married to Abner A., has four school-age children, and lives in the village of Purok 30, Barangay Taloc, Bago City, Negros Occidental. Abner, her husband, earns a living by driving a jeepney. Jeepneys are the most popular means of public transportation in the Philippines. The jeepney is like a small bus except that the passenger entrance is at the back and the passengers sit side by side on benches that face each other from both sides of the jeep's body. As a jeepney driver, Abner's income is not fixed and totally depends on the number of passengers he transports for the day who pay him seven pesos for the first four kilometers. He has to pay the daily rent to the jeepney's owner as well as pay for the fuel. Because of her dream in life, Jocelyn strives hard to reach it. Even though she had only a small capital, she opened a small general store and she plowed most of her initial income back into the business so that she could offer her customers a wider variety from her store. She joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2001 to have access to additional capital so that she could expand her business and increase her income potential. As she gained more profits from her business, Jocelyn expanded her business activities by setting up a food-vending business in her store. She offered a wide variety of food products to her customers. She still continues the food-vending because she noticed that food profits were a bit higher than those of her other products. Aside from the general store and the food-vending businesses, Jocelyn is also engaged in the direct-selling of various products. Most of her customers in this side business are also her customers in the general store and live within her community. She also has a computer station in her store for children to play computer games for a fee. Jocelyn started the original business eleven years ago and now her four business activities provide her with an average monthly income of PHP 20,000 per month. Jocelyn is very happy about the outcome of her hard work and sacrifices for her family because she was to able to meet her dream in life. For her previous, 18th, loan she was able to obtain the amount of Php 28,000 and it was used as additional capital for her four businesses and it was paid back to NWTF-Project Dungganon on time without any delays in payment. This contributes to the good performance of Jocelyn. For her 19th loan, Jocelyn proposed Php 15,000 which will be used to purchase additional items for her general store. If you look at the photo, it shows Jocelyn in her general store. At her back is the computer station that is played by the children. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To purchase additional items for her general store

loans.name: José Anibal

texts.es:
En el municipio El Viejo en la ciudad de Chinandega, el joven José P. es muy emprendedor puesto que estableció su propio negocio de barbería donde atiende a sus clientes a diario brindando un buen servicio y con muy buenas condiciones.

El crédito que solicitó es para inversión en la compra de materiales de trabajo como peines, gelatinas y tijeras y tambie´n para la compra de pintura para darle color a las paredes y también para reparar las sillas. Es por esta razón que el joven P. espera en que Ceprodel le brinde el crédito para continuar en su negocio.
texts.en:
In the municipality El Viejo in the city of Chinandega, José P. is a very enterprising young man, given that he established his own barber shop where he attends to his clients daily, providing a good service in very good conditions. The credit that he has requested is for investment in work materials, such as combs, gel, and scissors, and also for the purchase of paint to give color to the walls, and to repair his chairs. It is for this reason that the young P. hopes Ceprodel will provide him with the credit to continue his business.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase paint for the walls and upholstery for the chairs in his barber shop.

texts.es:
El señor Eliezer G. trabaja vendiendo pescado en el municipio El Viejo de la ciudad de Chinandega donde viaja largas distancias para comprar el producto y luego lo traslada vendiéndolo en unos grandes termos y ofreciéndolo a sus clientes que a diario le visitan para la compra de pescado.

Actualmente el señor Eliezer ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los pescados porque los requiere para almacenarlos en los termos y así ofrecerlos a sus clientes y es por esto que espera en que Ceprodel le brinde el crédito y así continuar mejorando las condiciones de su negocio.
texts.en:
Eliezer G. works selling fish in the El Viejo municipality of the city of Chinandega. He travels large distances to buy the product, and he transports and sells them in large Thermoses. He offers them to his customers who visit him daily to buy fish. Eliezer currently has come to Ceprodel to ask for a loan to buy fish. He needs them to store in the Thermoses and then offer to his customers. That is why he hopes that Ceprodel will give him a loan. This way he will continue to improve his business conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

texts.es:
La señora Amanda G. es una dama muy esforzada porque se ha preocupado por llevar el sustento a su hogar por medio de la venta de golosinas, frutas y algunos comestibles y bebidas los cuales son ofertadas en un lugarcito a la intemperie en el colegio María Begoña en el municipio El Viejo.

Ella solicita el crédito para invertirlo directamente en la compra de los comestibles y de esta manera continuar llevando el sustento a su hogar por medio del trabajo digno y esforzado.

texts.en: Olexander is married with one child. He sells various electrical goods at the central market in Mukachevo town. Olexander has been in this business for 5 years. He tried selling several types of goods, but then stopped on the electrical goods. There is low competition because most entrepreneurs at the market sell clothing. Olexander offers good quality products at good price gaining good reputation among his clients. He would like to increase the assortment of his inventories. To do so Olexander needs 11,000 UAH. He has used microloans before and found them very helpful for his business development.

texts.es: El grupo de Paquib Se encuentra en santa clara la laguna de Solola pueblecito de esasos recursos y las 14 señoras acudieron a la ASOCIACION ASDIR para apollar en sus capital ya que ellas se dedican a la compra y venta de ropa tipica, y lo venfden en otros lugares para la venta y ellas estan juntas para poder surtir la mercaderia y asi ser conpetitivas para las ventas y ellas tienen el anhelo de superar y asi tener mejor condiciones de vida para que sus hijos e hijas puedan estudiar y salir avante y tener mejor condicion de vida y el sueño màs grande es construir sus vivienda y darlo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Paquib group is from Santa Clara La Laguna in Solola. It is a small town with few resources. The 14 women went to the ASDIR ASSOCIATION for help with their capital since they all buy and sell typical clothing. They sell it in other places. They are together in order to supply the goods and this way be competitive with sales. They are eager to do better and have a better life so their sons and daughters can study, get ahead and have a better life. The biggest dream is to build their own homes and give their children the best.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

Galina is married and has two teenage children. She sells sport clothing at an open market in Ivano-Frankivsk town. She has been in this business for fifteen years and during this time she has obtained many repeat clients. This business is the only source of family income. 

Galina would like to borrow 6,500 UAH to increase her assortment. She will spend her additional income on finishing and improving her family’s living conditions.

texts.es: La señora Juana del Carmen L. ella tiene 41 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos, dos mayores de edad y dos que son menores. La señora Juana se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Por lo que es una madre muy responsable y quería que sus hijos obtuvieran la oportunidad de estudiar. Por lo que desde la edad de 20 años Juana inicio este negocio, ella con el poco capital que obtenía por medio de su esposo logro ahorrar algo de dinero, por lo anteriormente ella se dedica a la venta de frutas como naranjas y tomates. Ella tenía que buscar el medio de sobrevivir con sus hijos y su familia. Y así Juana no se rindió y ahora tiene este negocio. En la actualidad solicita este financiamiento que será invertido en la compra de mercancías para aprovechar el incremento de las ventas en los meses venideros. Su sueño es crecer en su negocio de tal forma que con el tiempo le permita llegar a establecer una pulpería en su casa de habitación.

A la vivienda del señor Edgar Faraón R. le esta haciendo falta poner vitropiso en la toda la casa.
Pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el vitropiso y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de colocar el piso. Es por eso que nos está solicitando un préstamo y realizar la mejora lo más pronto posible.
El señor Edgar Faraón planea pagar el crédito con los ingresos de su trabaja como chofer de un camión de carga. 
La persona que aparece en la foto es su esposa la señora Eydolisa Carreón  ya que el señor Edgar Faraón se encontraba en su trabaja.

Las personas integrantes del grupo PASANIEB, del Barrio Santa Ana, Momostenango han venido trabajando desde hace cinco años, ellos se dedican mayormente al comercio como una alternativa para obtener ingresos que contribuyen al sostenimiento de sus familias, otros se dedican a la venta de mercerías y otros a la crianza de animales, ellos han encontrado una excelente forma de trabajar y es a través de los micro créditos ya que permite de manera oportuna ampliar su capital de trabajo y de esta forma ampliar su capacidad de atención y el mejoramiento de sus ingresos.

texts.en: Larisa is married with one child. She sells clothing at the central market. Her monthly income is 4,000 UAH. Larisa has been in this business for 12 years. She enjoys selling clothing and has many repeated clients. Larisa is very active and hard working person. She would like to develop her business further and increase the sales. Larisa would like to borrow 16,400 UAH to purchase more inventories. Large assortment will help Larisa to increase the sales and receive additional income for her family.

loans.name: Alicia Dolores

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Nueva Esperanza, está formado por un grupo de socias muy unidas, dispuestas a salir adelante ante todas las adversidades de la vida, solidarias entre las compañeras y siempre con una mentalidad positiva irradian alegría en las reuniones quincenales  donde comparten sus vivencias del día a día, viven en  diferentes localidades  de la ciudad de Cuenca.

La señora Alicia Dolores Zuñiga vive en el sector de la Mutualista Azuay a unos 30 minutos a las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 48 años de edad, se encuentra felizmente casada tienen una buena relación conyugal, concibió cuatro hijos de 27, 26, 25, 14 años de edad, sus tres primeras hijas son profesionales en Contabilidad y Auditoría, le ayudan económicamente en su hogar, su último hijo  estudia en el colegio Antonia Ávila, su esposo es ejecutivo en ventas; juntos han  llegando a construir su casa propia fruto del esfuerzo de varios años.

Alicia tiene un bazar desde hace veinte y cinco años, además tiene una tienda de víveres hace cinco, nos comenta que las ventas han bajado un poco ya que se cambio de domicilio perdiendo toda su clientela, su horario de trabajo es de 7 a.m.  9 p.m., nos comenta que tener su tienda propia le beneficia mucho porque no sabe que es comprar por libras y que si algo le hace falta ocupa de su tienda.

Este es su tercer ciclo trabajando en su banco comunal, se siente satisfecha porque con los préstamos que ha recibido amplió su negocio y, con el crédito que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le entregue  va a invertir en la compra de mercadería  para surtir su tienda y comprar más artículos para su bazar como útiles escolares, articulos para el hogar, juguetes, etc.

El sueño de Alicia  es  que sus negocios sigan creciendo porque es el sustento para su familia.
texts.en:
Communal Bank Nueva Esperanza is formed by a group of very united members willing to overcome any life adversities. Solidarity is strong between the members and they always have a positive mentality. They shine joy in their bi-weekly meetings where they share their day-to-day lives. They live in different areas of the city of Cuenca. Mrs. Alicia Dolores Zuñiga lives in the Mutualista Azuay area about 30 minutes outside the city of Cuenca. She is 48 years old, happily married, and with a good marriage relationship. She has four children ages, 27, 26, 25, and 14. Her first 3 daughters are professionals in Accounting and Audits. They help her financially at home. Her youngest son attends Antonio Avila school. Her husband is a Sales Executive. Together, they have built their own home which is the fruit of many years of effort. Alicia has had a bazaar for 25 years. In addition, she has a store where she has sold provisions for 5 years. She tells us that sales have dropped because she moved and lost her clients. She works from 7am to 9pm. She tells us that owning her store is very beneficial because she doesn't know what is like to purchase things by pounds and if she needs something, she gets it from her store. This is her third cycle working with the bank. She feels satisfied because the loans have helped her improve her business and with the loan FUNDACION ESPOIR grants her, she will invest buying additional provisions for her store and more merchandise for her bazaar such as school supplies, home supplies, toys, etc. Alicia's dream is that her businesses continue to improve because they are what sustain the family.

Translated from Spanish by Linda Zamora, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise to further stock her store and bazaar with items such as school supplies, home supplies, toys, etc.

loans.name: Luz Aurora

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Nueva Esperanza, está formado por un grupo de socias muy unidas, dispuestas a salir adelante ante todas las circunstancias de la vida, solidarias entre las compañeras y siempre con una mentalidad positiva irradian alegría en las reuniones quincenales  donde comparten sus vivencias del día a día, viven por diferentes partes de la ciudad de Cuenca.

La señora Luz Aurora Guzmán vive por el sector Miraflores a unos 15 minutos a las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 51 años de edad, se encuentra casada y en su unión  matrimonial concibió 4 hijos de 32, 28, 26, 19 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos se encuentran casados llevando una  vida independiente con la familia que formaron, su último hijo es el que les acompaña, estudia mecánica y trabaja como chofer, el sueldo que gana es solo para sus gastos, su esposo trabaja como chofer y fruto de su esfuerzo en su juventud construyeron su casa.

Luz trabaja en su negocio de crianza  de pollos y cuyes lleva varios años en esta actividad,  éstos los vende en la Feria Libre o a sus vecinos cuando le piden; además tiene una vaca y la leche que obtiene la utiliza para el consumo en su hogar.
 
Luz  trabaja junto a la fundación cuatro ciclos y con los préstamos que la institución  le ha entregado a solventando las emergencias de dinero que ha tenido. Con el nuevo préstamo que la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR le entregue lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos, comida y vitaminas para seguir incrementando su negocio.

Su mayor sueño es  seguir desarrollándose personal y económicamente junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Communal Bank Nueva Esperance is formed by a very united group of members willing to overcome any life circumstances. Solidarity is shared among the members and they always have a positive mentality. They shine joy at their bi-weekly meetings where they share stories on their day-to-day lives. They live in different parts of the city of Cuenca. Mrs. Luz Aurora Guzmán lives in the Miraflores area about 15 minutes outside the city of Cuenca. She is 51 years old. She is married and has four children ages 32, 28, 26, and 19. Her first 3 children are married and have their own independent life with their families. Her youngest child keeps her company. He studies auto mechanic and works as a driver. His salary is only enough for his own expenses. Her husband works as a driver and the fruit of their efforts is a home they build in their youth. Luz works in her business raising chickens and guinea pigs. She has done this for several years. She sells them at the free market or to her neighbors when they ask for them. In addition she has a cow from which she gets milk and her family consumes. Luz works together with the foundation four cycles and with the loans the institution has granted her, she has used during financial emergencies. With the new loan FUNDACION ESPOIR grants her, she will invest buying more chickens, food, and vitamins to continue improving her business. Her main dream is to continue developing personally and financially together with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Linda Zamora, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens, food and vitamins to improve her business

texts.es:
Nelly se dedica a la Venta de productos de belleza por catalogo
Nelly continúa trabajando por que su esposo no tiene trabajo fijo, solo por temporadas, él es obrero de construcción, su hijo mayor trabaja y aportan a su casa pero no es suficiente porque su sueldo es poco, todavía tiene un hijo estudiando en la escuela.  
Necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles para la compra de otra vitrina exhibidora para sus productos de belleza colonias, talcos y cremas.
El sueño de Nelly es tener una bodega en su casa y terminar de construir su  casa.

Luz Maria tiene su negocio de taxi, que su esposo lo maneja. Ella es enfermera técnica, trabaja en un Centro Médico de Villa Maria al Sur de Lima, por las noches estudió podología por un año y este mes de setiembre se estará graduando como Podóloga. 
Los préstamos que recibe le permiten invertirlo en sus carros, Luz María necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para el arreglo técnico de sus carros.
El sueño de Maria es ahora ejercer su nueva carrera con eficacia

loans.name: Las Mayas Group

texts.es:
Tejido de mantas y chompas, venta de pescado, dulces, comida, condimentos, atención de tienda de barrio, son las actividades económicas de las integrantes del grupo Las Mayas que pertenecen al Centro Focal Panamericana. Se agruparon hace poco por la necesidad de contar con capital y hacer crecer sus negocios, algunos comprando materia prima y otras adquiriendo mercadería.
Una de las integrantes es Virginia C., mujer casada de 30 años con tres hijos pequeños, cuenta que se animó a entrar al grupo porque  necesita dinero para comprar materia prima (lana) ya que  teje mantas a máquina, hace 6 meses atrás se compro una máquina de tejer y desde entonces ha estado perfeccionando el tejido y elaborando mantas, ahora quiere incrementar su nivel de producción. 
Virginia compra la materia prima de la ciudad de La Paz, agencias de lana y vende su producto en la feria 16 de Julio ofreciendo a diferentes personas, los precios varían de Bs.- 85 a Bs.- 200, los más económicos  son de lana común, y los de mayor precio son de hilo.
texts.en:
Knitting blankets and sweaters, selling fish, candy, food, and condiments, and running neighborhood stores are the economic activities of the members of the Las Mayas group, who belong to the Panamerican Regional Hub. They joined forces recently due to their need to raise capital and make their businesses grow, some by purchasing raw materials and others by acquiring merchandise. One of the members is Virginia C., a married woman who is 30 years old with three small children. She says that she was excited to join the group because she needs money to buy raw materials (wool) since she knits blankets on a machine. Six months ago she bought the knitting machine and since then has been perfecting the technique and producing blankets. Now she wants to increase her level of production. Virginia buys her raw materials from wool vendors in the city of La Paz and sells her products to a variety of customers at the 16th of July market. Prices range from 85 to 200 bolivianos, with the most economical made of common wool and those of higher price made of yarn.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of raw materials (wool) and merchandise

loans.name: Jesus De Los Milagros

texts.es:
Jesús tiene una bodega donde vende bebidas en su casa, ella trabaja de lunes a jueves hasta la 1 de la madrugada y viernes, sábados y domingos las 24 horas del día, ha contratado una persona para que le ayude.
Jesús reconoce que es un negocio riesgoso porque a veces se presentan dificultades con los clientes, pero continua con el negocio porque está separada de su pareja y tiene que mantener a sus tres hijas. 
Necesita un préstamo de 2600 soles, para la compra de bebidas (gaseosas de todas las marcas y tamaños)al por mayor y gaseosas, le está yendo muy bien en el negocio.
El sueño de Jesús es emprender otro negocio, aun está evaluando posibilidades y nos manifiesta que sería bueno poner una carpintería.

loans.use: compra de bebidas al por mayor

loans.name: Monica Catalina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Nueva Esperanza, está formado por un grupo de socias muy unidas, dispuestas a salir adelante ante todas las adversidades de la vida, solidarias entre las compañeras y siempre con una mentalidad positiva irradian alegría en las reuniones quincenales  donde comparten sus vivencias del día a día, viven en  diferentes localidades  de la ciudad de Cuenca.

La señora Mónica M. vive en el sector Carmen de Sinincay ubicado a unos 45 minutos  a las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 32 años de edad, es casada, procreó dos hijos: de 5 años y una bebe de 1 mes de nacida, su hijo  estudia en la escuela Francisco Dávila pasó al segundo año de educación básica, su esposo trabaja como taxista en una cooperativa de la localidad; aún no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en una casa prestada de un familiar.
 
Mónica trabaja en su gabinete de belleza desde hace siete años, el local donde atiende es arrendado, nos comenta que hay días buenos y malos pero hay que  saber agradecer a Dios por todo lo que nos brinda; tiene varios  años de experiencia lo que le ha permitido  llegar a tener su clientela fija.

También nos comenta que gracias a  su trabajo obtiene dinero  a diario para ayudarse con los gastos de su  hogar y  pagar el arriendo del local,  su horario de trabajo es de 8 a.m. a  8 p.m. de lunes a sábados todo el día. 

Este es  su sexto ciclo junto al banco comunal, se siente muy agradecida con la fundación porque le ha permitido  mejorar su negocio, asociarse con otras mujeres  para generar sus propios ingresos y lo más importante cultivar una buena relación de amistad con todas las socias de su banco.

 Con el préstamo que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le entregue va a invertir en la compra de productos como: líquidos permanentes, tintes, esmaltes, tratamientos, etc. para mejorar su negocio y brindar un servicio de calidad

El  mayor sueño  de Mónica es  llegar a tener su casa propia y ahí montar su gabinete de belleza.
texts.en:
The communal bank Nueva Esperanza (New Hope) includes a group of members who are very united, willing to continue moving ahead despite the adversities of life. They are partners in solidarity who always have a positive attitude; they radiate happiness in the bi-monthly meetings where they share their everyday experiences. They live in different areas in the City of Cuenca. Señora Mónica M. lives in the Carmen sector of Sinincay, located 45 minutes outside the outskirts of the City of Cuenca. She is 32 years old, married, mother of two children: one who is 5 years old and the other a 1-month old baby.
