Her older son is studying in the Francisco Dávila school where he has completed his second year of basic education. Her husband works as a taxi driver in a local cooperative. They do not yet have a house of their own; they live in a rented house owned by a relative. Monica has worked in her beauty parlor for 7 years. The premises are leased. She tells us that there are good days and bad days, but one must give thanks to God for everything He provides to us. Her many years of experience have enabled her to develop her clientele. She also told us that thanks to her work she is able to obtain money on a daily basis to help with the household expenses and pay the rent on her parlor. She works from 8am to 8pm from Monday to Saturday each week. This is her sixth cycle with the communal bank. She is very grateful to the foundation because it has allowed her to improve her business, to associate with other women to help generate their incomes, and, most importantly, to cultivate good friendships with all of the members of her bank. With this loan that the ESPOIR foundation is giving her, she is going to purchase products such as: permanent solution, hair dyes, nail enamel, beauty treatments, etc., in order to improve her business and provide quality service. Monica's biggest dream is to have her own house, where she could put up her own beauty parlor.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy beauty products such as permanent solution, hair dyes, nail enamels, etc.

texts.es:
Luz Amalia tiene dos negocios, hacen movilidad escolar, su esposo maneja una de las combis,  en diferentes horarios llevan 30 niños al colegio en Nueva Esperanza, también tienen una  bodega donde vende gas, en este negocio las ventas han bajado bastante.  
Necesita un préstamo de 2800 soles, para compra de 4 llantas para sus carros y realizar algunos arreglos de la combi.
El sueño de Luz es tener una flota de autos.
texts.en:
Luz Amalia has two businesses, one of which is taking children to school. Her husband drives one of their small vans and takes 30 kids to school in Nueva Esperanza at different times during the day. They also have a small shop where they sell soda. Sales in this business have dropped significantly. She needs a loan of 2800 soles to buy 4 tires for their vehicles and to make a few repairs on the van. Luz dreams of having lots of cars.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Maribel es socia del bancomunal Maria de la Paz, es madre soltera, tiene 37 años, dos hijos de 15 y 6 años que están estudiando en el escuela estatal.
Maribel termino la escuela y se puso a trabajar en ventas de productos por catálogo, empezó a tener muchas clientas y a crecer en el negocio, cuando decidió vender menú a una empresa de trasporte San Judas Tadeo, vende 50 menús diarios y también con sus ahorros ha podido comprar un carro que lo da  en alquiler para taxi.
En Finca Perú Maribel aprendió ahorrar, a  separar su ganancias y hacer solidarias con su amigas del Bancomunal, entender cuando el negocio está bajo y poderse ayudar.  
Maribel necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles para la compra de llantas para su carro.
El sueño de Maribel es tener una empresa de Taxi, y cree que con empeño lo logrará, para asegurar el futuro de sus hijos.

“Kantutas”, es el nombre de la asociación comunal que reúne a un grupo de mujeres trabajadoras, la mayoría con responsabilidades familiares, esta situación las ha obligado a buscar una fuente de ingreso para cubrir  los gastos de sus hogares, como ser la alimentación, estudios y necesidades de los hijos. Actualmente este grupo tiene actividades distintas, por ejemplo Feliza se dedica a la venta de papa y chuño, Alicia confecciona calzados, Lidia vende cosméticos, Celia vende carne de res, Elsa vende leche, Productos que comercian en distintas ferias de su zona, o en las principales feria del Alto. Ellas precisan capital para comprar de mercadería, con esta adquisición  generaran  los recursos suficientes para hacer frente a la difícil situación económica por la que afirman, están atravesando.
texts.en:
“Kantutas” is the name of the community association that brings together a group of women entrepreneurs, most of whom have family responsibilities. Their situations have forced them to seek sources of income to cover their living expenses such as food, education, and other needs for their children.

The group is currently involved in distinct activities. For example, Feliza sells potatoes (fresh & freeze-dried), Alicia sells shoes, Lidia sells cosmetics, Celia sells beef, and Elsa sells milk. They sell their products at various fairs throughout the area or at the main fair in El Alto. They need capital to buy more merchandise, and with this acquisition, will be able to generate sufficient income to cope with the difficult economic situations they are experiencing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
José es socio del Bancomunal María de la Paz, es casado, tiene 60 años, cinco hijos mayores que están casados.
José es de Cajamarca (del Norte del Perú), llegó a Lima a trabajar y a estudiar para profesor, trabajó por 20 años hasta que se jubiló y decidió hacer algo diferente, empezó a trabajar como cobrador de combi, por varios años con los ahorros de años compró un carro de segunda (usado) y se puso a dar servicio de taxi, esta labor la realiza hasta hasta el día de hoy. 
En Finca Perú José encontró una nueva manera de ahorrar y una familia que le ayuda a surgir. 
José necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para la compra de llantas para su carro.
José ha realizado todos sus sueños, pudo dar educación a sus hijos y sacar adelante a su familia ahora él quiere seguir trabajando para darle lo mejor a su esposa.
texts.en:
José is a member of the community bank María de la Paz. He is married, 60 years old and has five children who are all married. José is from Cajamarca (in the north of Peru). He came to Lima to work and study to be a teacher and worked for 20 years until he retired and decided to do something different. He began to work as a bus conductor, and with the money he saved from various years of work he bought a second hand used car and started a taxi service, which he still runs today. In Finca Perú José found a new way to save and to help his family to move forward. He now needs a loan of 1200 soles to buy tyres for his car. José has realised all his dreams; he was able to educate his children and get his family ahead in life. Now all he wants is to continue working to give his wife the best he can.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Daniela es socia del Bancomunal Nuevo Amanecer, es conviviente, tiene 62 años y 4 hijos que están casados y viven con ella, pero en diferentes pisos de su casa.
Daniela tenía un taller familiar de calzado, lo cerró porque la competencia era muy grande, empezaron a llegar zapatos de China y los pedidos que le hacían bajaron, con los ahorros de su negocio pudo comprar una casa, pero en cascaron, es decir una casa no terminada, la zona donde ella vive es una zona donde buscan bastante alquiler de cuartos, Daniela tuvo la idea de construir su casa con cuartos para alquilar.
En FINCA Perú ella aprendió con las capacitaciones como sacar los ingresos y egresos y separa sus ganancias.
Daniela  necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles para hacer  de las habitaciones que alquila.

Maria es socia del Bancomunal Nuevo Amanecer, es madre soltera tiene 52 años, tiene 6 hijos mayores que están casados, solo el menor de 18 años vive con ella.  
Maria siempre se dedico a su casa y cuidar a sus hijos, en un sorteo se saco un carro y lo ha puesto para dar servicio de taxi, ella trabaja en una automotriz llamada "La Mar", ella es la cajera, tiene trabajando varios años.
Hace tres años se dedica a la confección de bolsos en hilo, aprendió a tejer y esta haciendo bolsos  y los vende en su trabajo.
En Finca Perú ella lleva 6 años y los préstamos le han sacado de muchos apuros, aprendió a ser responsable y organizada en los pagos y organizada en su trabajo, gracias a las capacitaciones que ha recibido en el Bancomunal.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles, para el arreglo de su carro, va pasar revisión técnica.
El sueño de Maria es tener tener un negocio de venta al por mayor de tejido de carteras.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of communal bank Bancomunal Nuevo Amanecer. She is 52 years old and a single mother of 6 children. All her children are grown up and married except for her youngest one who is 18 and still lives with her. Maria always dedicated time to her home and the care of her children. She won a car in a raffle and has used it to provide taxi services. She works at an automotive shop called "La Mar" as a cashier. She has worked there for several years.Three years ago, she began making purses with yarn. She learned how to crochet and is making purses to sell at her place of work. She has been in Finca, Peru for six years and the loans have gotten her out of many problems. She learned to be responsible and organized with her payments and organized at work, thanks to the training she has received at Bancomunal. Maria needs the loan to fix her car to be able to pass technical revision. Maria's dream is to have her own business whole selling the purses she crochets.

Translated from Spanish by Linda Zamora, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: Hace diez años aproximadamente, en el centro focal Senkata se reúne la asociación “illimani” esta formada por trece socias muy trabajadoras que se dedican principalmente a la elaboración de comida y en algunos casos al comercio de distintos productos (plásticos, ropa interior, carteras, sombreros y otros), algunas cuentan con pensiones propias, y en otros casos tienen puestos en vías publicas. Ellas precisan de capital para poder comprar mercadería o insumos esto hará reactivar sus negocios.
texts.en:
About ten years ago, thirteen hard-working women from Senkata formed the Illimani group. Group members mostly sell food, though some of them deal in plastic goods, underwear, wallets, hats, etc. Some members have their own storefronts, while others are set up along public roads. The Illimani group will use this loan to invest in and re-invigorate their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: La señora Aura A. M., ella tiene 42 años, tiene 3 hijos menores de edad. La señora Aura se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y usada en esto incluye venta de ropa de cama, camisas, pantalones, etc, los cuales distribuye generalmente de forma ambulante, también en su casa realiza ventas, las cuales en su mayoría son a crédito. Ella dio inicio a este negocio porque no tena un medio de supervivencia y al mismo tiempo no encontraba trabajo. Este negocio le ha servido como fuente de ingresos para ella y para la manutención de su familia. Esta solicitando un financiamiento que será invertido en la compra de mercaderías principalmente ropa usada ya que debido a la crisis es la que más se vende. Ella posee el sueño de hacer que el negocio crezca lo suficiente para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda realizar mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Miss Aura A. M. is 42 years old and has three young children. Miss Aura sells new and used clothing including bed linens, shirts, pants, etc., which she generally distributes in the form of a ‘mobile store.’ She also makes sales from her house, of which the majority is on credit. She started this business because she didn’t have a way to survive and she couldn’t find a job. This business has given her a source of income for herself and for the maintenance of her family. She is asking for a loan that will be invested in the purchase of mainly used clothing merchandise since due to the crisis this is what she sells the most of. She has a dream of growing her business enough so that in the near future she can make improvements on her house.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Bancomunal Nuevo Amanecer, es casada, tiene 52 años, dos hijos de 31 y 21 años que trabajan y estudian. 
Julia trabajaba en ventas en una tienda, pero la tienda quebró y ella se quedo sin trabajo, se puso a vender productos de belleza por catálogo, pero desde jovencita ella le gustaba tejer y siempre tejía para ella y su familia, hasta que un día una amiga le dijo que le tejiera un poncho y la animó a tejer para que venda, fue a si como ella empezó a tejer para vender por pedidos, a la semana ella teje 4 ponchos.
En Finca Perú tiene 4 años, aprendió mucho con las capacitaciones que ha recibido, ahora sabe como sacar su ganancia por que antes todo lo mezclaba, aprendió como vender un producto frente a la competencia.
Julia necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles, va arreglar una parte de su casa y le va poner una reja para mayor seguridad para poderlo alquilar.
El sueño de Julia es que su hijo último sea un profesional y cada vez tener mas pedidos de tejido.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Nuevo Amanecer community bank. She is 52 years old, married, and has two children. They are 31 and 21 years old, and work and study.

Julia used to work in sales at a store, but the store went bankrupt and she was left without a job. She began to sell beauty products by catalog, but since she was young, she liked to knit and she would always knit for herself and her family. One day, a friend of hers asked her to knit a poncho and she was inspired to knit to sell. This is how she began to knit to sell by request. She knits 4 ponchos per week.

She has been with Finca Perú for 4 years and she learned a lot with the trainings that she has received. Now she knows how to make earnings because before, she was mixing it. She learned to sell a product when faced with competition.

Julia needs a loan of 3000 PEN to fix a part of her house. She is going to put up a railing to increase security so that she can rent it.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es:
Jacinta es socia del Bancomunal Nuevo Amanecer, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos de 22 y 11 años este ultimo esta en la escuela estatal.
Julia es de la provincia de Abancay, en Lima estudio Joyería en un instituto por tres años, por que su familia se dedica al negocio de joyería y ella estudiaba para viajar a otro país y trabajar  haciendo joyas, pero por diferentes problemas no llego a viajar y se puso a trabajar en venta de ropa, puso una  tienda, le estaba yendo bien, cuando una noche le robaron todo su mercadería de su tienda, ella dejo el negocio, con el tiempo decidió empezar a ahorra para invertir en la construcción de su casa para alquilarla. 
En Finca Perú ella aprendió ahorra, a no darse por vencida, que todo se logra con esfuerzo y buen actitud ante las dificultades.
Jacinta necesita y un préstamo de 1200 soles, para arreglos, acabados de una parte de su casa para alquiler.
El sueño de Jacinta es volver a abrir una tienda en gamarra y vender ropa.

loans.use: acabados de una parte de su casa

loans.name: Salome

texts.es:
Salome  es socia del Bancomunal Nuevo Amanecer, es casada tiene 52 años 4 hijos el menor tiene 14 años y esta estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Salome es ayacuchana ella empezó vendiendo papa sancochada con huevo, estuvo como ambulante por dos años en los mercados, hasta que pudo comprar un puesto con los ahorros y el apoyo D. toda su familia, así fueron creciendo en el negocio, su padre le dio una herencia D. una chacra en Arequipa, su esposo trabaja allí sembrando peras D. agua, junto con su hijo, ella compro un terreno y lo ha ido construyendo poco a poco.
En Finca Perú ella aprendió a invertir, aprendió a administrar gracias a las capacitaciones que ha recibido, es ella que administra todos lo que tiene. 
Salome necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles, va invertir en juguetes y artículos D. bazar.
El sueño D. Salome es comprase un camión para traer las frutas D. su chacra y venderlas en Lima.

loans.use: invertir en juguetes y artículos de bazar

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Bancomunal Nuevo Amanecer, es casada, tiene 52 años, cuatro hijos todos casados, independientes.
Rosa decidió abrir en su garaje una tienda D. abarrotes, tuvo mucha acogida en la zona y las ventas eran buenas, se compraron un carrito D. segunda que lo dejaban en la puerta D. su casa hasta que intentaron robarle en dos oportunidades, entonces tuvo que cerrar la tienda para guardar ahí su carro. Para tener un ingreso adicional, decidió alquilar partes D. su casa. 
DesD. que empezó en Finca Perú hace dos años, se ha dedicado a construir su casa, gracias a los préstamos que ella recibe cada periodo. ahora solicita un préstamo D. 2400 para levantar paredes y tener un ambiente mas para alquilar.
El sueño D. Rosa es incursionar en otro negocio para tener mas entradas, esta pensando en su vejez por que ella no tiene seguro D. salud.

loans.name: Luchando Por El Progreso 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Lucrecia is the coordinator of her group: Luchando por el Progreso (Fighting for Progress). Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian (many of whom recently emigrated from Haiti to the Dominican Republic) and Dominican clients. Her group is based in the outskirts of La Romana. Here she makes her home with her children in a structure of plywood with a tin roof which she owns but does not have title too.

Lucrecia originally came to Esperanza with the goal of starting a business and she has been with Esperanza for four loan cycles now, successfully repaying each time. With this new loan she continues to invest in her business of running a "san". A san is an operation in which several neighbors come together and put money into a collective each week for a predetermined amount of time and at the end of that time one member of the group receives a packet of goods. This is repeated until each member has had a turn receiving the packet. Thus it is a setup in which neighbors pool resources. In this case our associate is purchasing the goods to be given to each one of the members of her groups at the end of the cycle. She will collect a fee for providing the goods.

With the profits from this enterprise Lucrecia intends to invest in adding a concrete floor to her house (something which will greatly improve her living conditions and reduce exposure to disease) and to purchase glasses for her daughter to enable her to see. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy a sack of rice, a gallon of cooking oil, a large can of salsa and boxes of soup

texts.es: El grupo de Panyebar II Han Acudido en la ASOCIACION DE ASDIR para solicitar ayuda para incrementar sus capitales ya que ellas han trabajado unos 5 años con anterioridad,y las ventas lo realizan en otros lugares; Ellas quieren reforzar sus ventas ya que la competencia es demasiada alta y ellas quieren ser conpetitivas para sobre salir y asi mantener a sus familias y quieren sacar a sus hijos avantes en los estudios ya que en esa zona son M. pobres, y el trabajo del hombre es M. escasos por esa razon ellas qluchan para mantener a su familia.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio tiene 30 años, vive con su pareja y madre de sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde muy joven se dedica a la siembra de papa en grandes cantidades y hace un tiempo atrás llegó a costar muy caro dicho producto, fue entonces cuando pudo comprar un camión. Desde ese momento, también brinda el servicio de transporte de carga a distintas zonas, donde le pagan hasta 400 soles por cada camionada. Y en caso de haber una temporada de buen precio de la papa, él mismo lleva su producto a los mercados de la ciudad de Lima, ahorrándose así el pago de transporte de sus productos. Antonio está muy contento, pues estas actividades le permiten obtener las ganancias necesarias para solventar los gastos de su familia.
Este es su octavo crédito con MFP, en su banco comunal se siente muy bien, ya que se ha hecho amistad con todos los integrantes, además es una personas bastante bromista en las reuniones del grupo.Con el dinero que solicita comprará 20 sacos de papa (semilla) y una llanta de repuesto para su camión.
texts.en:
Antonio is 30 years old and lives in his own house with his partner and wife of his two children. Since he was very young, he has grown potatoes in large quantities. Some time ago, potatoes became very expensive and it was then that he was able to buy a truck. Since then, he has also provided cargo transportation service to various areas, where he is paid up to 400 PEN for each truckload. In the case when potatoes are at a good price, he brings his product to the markets in Lima himself, thus saving on the cost of transporting his products. Antonio is very happy because these activities allow him to obtain the necessary earnings to help with household expenses.

This is Antonio’s eighth loan with MFP. He feels very good at his community bank because he has become friends with all of the members and he makes a lot of jokes at the group meetings. With this loan, he will purchase 20 sacks of potato (seeds) and a spare tire for his truck.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and a tire for his truck

texts.es:
Betty es una mujer muy alegre de 29 años, vive con sus dos hijos en su casa propia. Se dedica a la siembra de papas en sus propias chacras y en otras alquiladas, a ella le gusta trabajar en sus cultivos y también criar animales, pero lo que más le place es trabajar junto a su esposo. Betty se levantan muy temprano, para preparar los alimentos del día, mientras su esposo corta la avena y alimenta a las vacas. Alrededor de las 8 de la mañana, ordeña y entrega la leche a su vecina, quien produce quesos. Posteriormente, su esposo sujeta a las vacas en el campo, Betty carga el almuerzo y juntos se dirigen a sus chacras para remover la tierra y quitar las hierbas. Llegado la cosecha, contratan peones, para que cada miércoles por la mañana estén en el mercado de mayoristas de la ciudad comercializando sus productos y con las ganancias obtenidas compran víveres y felices regresan a casa.
Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y ha demostrando ser una cliente muy responsable en sus pagos, también muy alegre y se lleva bien con todos los miembros de su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para la siembra de papas.
texts.en:
Betty is a very happy 29-year-old woman. She lives with her two children in her own house. She grows potatoes on her own small pieces of farmland and on other rented ones. She likes to work on her crops and raise animals, but what she likes most is to work alongside her husband. Betty gets up very early to prepare the food for the day, while her husband cuts the oats and feeds the cows. Around 8am, she tidies up and brings milk to the neighbor, who makes cheeses. After, her husband ties up the cows in the countryside. Betty is responsible for lunch and together, they manage their farmlands to turn over the land and take out the weeds. When the harvest arrives, they contract farm workers so that they can be at the wholesale market every Wednesday promoting their products and with their earnings, they buy supplies and return home happy.

This is her second loan with MFP and she has proven to be a very responsible client with her payments. She is also very happy and gets along well with all of the members of her community bank. She will invest the loan that she is requesting in the purchase of chemical fertilizers for her potato crops.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Enriqueta es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 42 años y vive con su pareja y padre D. sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. ElL. tiene terrenos temporales (según L. lluvia) que son apropiados para L. siembra D. papas y olluco, auque le gustaría también producir arvejas, pero el clima muy frío perjudica este producto. Enriqueta está satisfecha porque tanto L. papa como el olluco son productos muy rentables, sobre todo el olluco, pues en algunas ocasiones ha llegado en vender hasta 120 soles cada saco. ElL. comenta que “es cuestión D. suerte”, pues el precio varía D. un momento al otro. Adicionalmente; en algunas ocasiones, junto a su esposo trabajan en las chacras D. sus vecinos, donD. le pagan 15 soles a elL. y 18 a él. D. ese modo, estas ganancias extras les sirven para sus necesidades diarias.
Este es su octavo préstamo con MFP y está muy agradecida porque estos créditos le han permitido incrementar su producción agrícoL., es por ello que no deja D. asistir a sus reuniones del banco comunal. El dinero que viene solicitando lo invertirá en L. compra D. fertilizantes químicos para sus chacras D. papa.
texts.en:
Enriqueta is a very hardworking woman, she is 42 and lives with her partner and father of his 4 children in a house they own. She has seasonal land (depending on rain) that are suitable for cultivating potatoes and other root vegetables, she would also like to produce peas, but the cold weather is not good for this product. Enriqueta is pleased because the potatoes and other root vegetables are profitable because in a few occasions she has been able to sell them at $120 “soles” per sac. She indicates that “it’s a matter of luck”, because prices vary from one moment to the next. In addition, she occasionally works with her husband in their neighboors’ land, where she gets paid $15 “soles” and he gets paid $18 “soles”, these are additional earnings that are useful to cover their everyday needs. This is the 8th loan with MFP and she is very thankful because these loans have allowed her to increase production and that’s why she keeps attending the community bank meetings. The money requested will be invested in buying chemical fertilizer for the potatoes.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Kiko es un joven soltero de 25 años, es muy trabajador y vive en la casa de su madre. Se dedica a la agricultura desde niño, es por ello que le causa gran complacencia trabajar en sus cultivos, ya que cada vez que siembra es muy cuidadoso y paciente, pues sólo así logra  cosechar productos limpios y sin gusanos, para que no se malogren cuando estén guardados. Cada una de sus cosechas las lleva a un depósito en la ciudad donde llegan los compradores de la costa y logra obtener buen precio por sus papas, según el tamaño y la variedad de semilla. Estas ganancias las comparte con sus padres y hermanos y eso lo hace sentir muy feliz. Por ello, está pensando, para un futuro cercano, comprar sus propios terrenos, para que de ese modo sus hermanos menores siembren en las chacras de sus padres también.
Este es su octavo crédito con MFP, por lo que está muy agradecido, ya que cada crédito le ha sido de mucha ayuda, por tal motivo también asiste puntualmente a todas las reuniones de su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita será para la compra de fertilizantes químicos para su siguiente siembra de papas.
texts.en:
Kiko is a very hard working 25 year-old single man who lives with his mother. He has worked in agriculture since he was a child and he enjoys working on his crops. He is very careful and patient with each crop as it is the only way to harvest clean products, without worms, that will not spoil when they are in storage. He sells his harvest at a warehouse in the city to buyers from the coast, and he obtains good prices for his potatoes, based on the size and seed variety. He shares his earnings with his parents and siblings and it makes him very happy. He is thinking of buying his own land in the near future, so that his younger siblings can also work in his parents’ small subsistence farm.

This is his eight loan with MFP and he is very appreciative since each loan has been a great help. He has been very punctual to his community bank’s meetings. The funds that he is requesting will be used to purchase chemical fertilizers for his next potato crop.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: Este es un grupo llamado Grupo Solidario Rafaela Herrera II, está conformado por Zaida del Socorro García M. y Emeteria R. E.. Ellas son personas muy trabajadoras, las  dos tienen sus propios negocios. Zaida se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general y Emeteria se dedica a la venta de ropa, a pesar de tener una niña que esta enferma con mucha mas razon ella tiene todos los sacrificios por salir adelante y apoyar en lo necesario a su hija que lo necesita. Por lo que ambas tienen mucho tiempo en las diferentes actividades económicas. El financiamiento que solicitan es para capital de trabajo para materia prima que es necesaria para sus negocios. Ambas luchan por proporcionarles a sus familias estabilidad económica de sus humildes actividades.
texts.en:
This is the Rafaela Herrera II Solidarity Group, whose members are Zaida del Socorro García M. and Emeteria R. E.. They are very hardworking women, and both have their own businesses. Zaida sells general merchandise and Emeteria has a business selling clothing, despite having to care for her disabled daughter. This gives her even more reason to make sacrifices to get ahead and to provide the necessary support for all of her daughter's needs. Both Zaida and Emeteria have spent a lot of time on their different business activities. They are requesting a loan for working capital to invest in supplies for their businesses. Both struggle to provide a stable financial situation for their families with the earnings from their humble businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Teresa  es socia del Bancomunal Nuevo Amanecer, es casada, tiene 40 años,  4 hijos de 24, 22, 20 y 18 años, todos solteros.
Teresa de joven salio embarazada y se dedico a cuidar a sus hijos, pasado los años ella se dedico a las ventas de cosas por temporada, hasta que hace cinco años atrás con su esposo se dedicó a la fabricación de fibra de vidrio, hacen tinas para baños, lavatorios, ella en el negocio se dedica a cobrar, a visitar a los posibles los clientes.
En Finca Perú ella aprendió a ser responsable, a trabajar en grupo, los prestamos son de gran ayuda.  
Teresa necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de materiales para la fabricación de tinas, resina, rollos de fibra.
El sueño de Teresa es  que sus clientes aumenten y tengan mas pedidos.
texts.en:
Teresa is a member of the Communal Bank “Nuevo Amanecer” (New Dawn). She is 40 years old, married, and has 4 children (ages 24, 22, 20, and 18). All of them are single.

Teresa became pregnant at a young age and dedicated herself to taking care of her children. She spent many years selling seasonal items. Five years ago, her husband started manufacturing fiberglass for making products such as bathtubs and sinks. Teresa is now in charge of finding and visiting with potential customers.

As a client of FINCA Perú, she has learned to be responsible and work as part of a group. Her loans have been very helpful. Teresa needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy materials for making bathtubs, such as resin and fiber rolls.

Teresa dreams of having more customers and receiving more orders.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Shale es una mujer muy responsable, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos. Se dedica a la agricultura, alquila chacras para sembrar papas y arvejas, pues considera que estos productos son muy rentables. Pero es su esposo quien más se dedica a sus cultivos, ya que Shale aprovecha la zona para pastar sus vacas. Y cuando dan leche, logra juntar hasta 18 litros al día, los cuales vende a una vecina que elabora quesos. Es por ello que Shale no puede descuidar a sus vacas, ya que le permiten obtener recursos mientras su esposo se dedica a sus cultivos. Pero durante la temporada de cosecha, deja a sus vacas pastando solas, para que ella pueda apoyar a su esposo en la recolección de las papas.
Este es su octavo préstamo con MFP, donde todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser muy responsable en sus pagos, por lo que se ha ganado el aprecio de los integrantes de su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes químicos, para su próxima siembra de papas.
texts.en:
Shale is a very responsible woman. She is 39 years old, married, and has 3 children. She is engaged in agriculture, growing potatoes and peas from a rented field. These crops are considered to be very profitable. Her husband is more devoted to cultivating the crops, so she takes advantage of caring for her cows and letting them out to graze. When it is time for them to produce milk, Shale collects up to 18 liters each day and sells it to a neighbor who makes cheese. For this reason, she cannot neglect her cows because they provide her with an income, which leaves her husband responsible for tending to the crops. During the harvest season, she allows her cows to graze alone while she helps her husband gather potatoes.

This is Shale’s eighth loan with MFP. Throughout this time, she has demonstrated that she is very responsible with her payments and has earned the appreciation of the members of her Communal Bank. The money she is requesting will be used to buy chemical fertilizers for her next crop of potatoes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Willian tiene 30 años, vive con su pareja y madre de sus 2 hijos su casa propia. Para él, la agricultura es una actividad muy agradable, cuenta con terrenos heredados de sus padres donde siembra papas y olluco. Pero también le gusta sembrar arvejas; por ello, fuera de su pueblo, siembra en chacras arrendadas. Las arvejas son un producto muy rentables, no pierde y cosecha hasta tres veces por cada siembra. Mientras que la papa se cosecha una vez al año y se debe invertir mayor cantidad de dinero. William prefiere vender sus productos desde su misma chacra, de ese modo se evita los ajetreos del transporte y obtiene buenas ganancias sin mayores complicaciones.
Este es su octavo crédito con MFP, él ha demostrado ser muy puntual en sus pagos, por ello se incomoda cuando el resto de los integrantes de su grupo no lo hacen así. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para abonar sus cultivos de papa.
texts.en:
William is 30 years old and lives in his own home with his partner, who is the mother of their two children. For him, farming has been a very good occupation. He inherited land from his parents in which he grows potatoes and ulluco. He also likes to plants peas, and has leased a field outside of his village in order to do this. Peas are a very profitable crop because it can be harvested three times with each planting, while potatoes can only be harvested once a year and require more financial investment. William prefers to sell his products directly from his farm, thus avoiding the hassle of transporting goods and obtaining the best prices with major complications.

This is William’s eighth loan with MFP. He has demonstrated that he is very punctual with his payments and became very uncomfortable when other members of his group were not able to do so the same. The money he requested will be used to purchase chemical fertilizers for his potato crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: Las Mujeres del grupo Pahaj han llegado a la ASOCIACION ASDIR para pedir ayuda por incrementar sus capitales y asi poder vender y obtener màs ganancias para el sostenimiento de sus familia ya que ellas se dedican a la compra y venta de ropa tipica  y estas ventas que relizan en otros pueblos con el fin de obtener otro nivel de vida ya que ellas caminan  mucho para llegar a vender sus mercaderia y asi poder ayudar a sus hijos tanto en los gastos escolares como en la comida y ropa de ellos por lo tanto acuden para darle ese apoyo ya que en el Municipio de Nahualà hay mucha pobreza. Ya que los hombre ganan muy poco y ellas tienen que ir a vender las ropas tipicas muy lejanas a la localidad para luego traer el sustento.

El señor Néstor S. C., tiene  30 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo que es menor de edad. El es dueño de un negocio de venta de medicamentos, los cuales distribuye de forma ambulante en un bolso grande con la ayuda de su esposa. Don Néstor dio inicio a su negocio hace 9 años, inicio con muy poco capital obtenido de un ingreso adicional, ya que él además de tener su negocio, también es maestro de escuela primaria. El crédito será invertido en la compra de medicamentos a ser distribuidos. Su sueño es llegar a establecer una farmacia, que es para lo que actualmente está estudiando para ser farmaceuta, esto con el objetivo de obtener mejores ingresos que mejoren su calidad de vida y de su familia en general.
texts.en:
Nestor is 30 years old, married, and has a boy who is still a minor. Nestor's a business is selling medicines, which he carries in a large bag, with his wife's help, and distributes on foot. Nestor started his business 9 years ago, with little capital, obtained from an additional income. He is also a primary school teacher.

Nestor's loan will be invested in buying medications to be distributed. His dream is to be able to establish a pharmacy. For that purpose, he is presently studying to be a pharmacist so he can obtain a better income and improve the quality of life for himself and his family generally.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: La señora Elia Maria A., realiza la actividad de venta de tortilla en su casa de habitación desde. Hace mas 31 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que siempre se ha caracterizado por ofrecer a sus clientes tortillas de calidad en su cuadra es conocida como marillita, por lo que es una persona muy reconocida. Ella siempre ha salido adelante con mucho esfuerzo ya que es siempre le gusto trabajar de manera humilde. Actualmente solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será utilizado para la compra de maíz, comal, cal entre otras cosas. Su mayor sueño es proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elia Maria A. sells tortillas from her house. For more than 31 years she has made a living in this business and has always been characterized as offering quality tortillas to her clients. On her block she is known as Marillita (Little Maria) and is a very well-recognized person. She has always moved forward with a lot of effort and has always liked to work in a humble manner. Currently she is requesting this financing for capital that will be used for the purchase of corn, hotplates, and lime, among other things. Her greatest dream is to make improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
El señor José Antonio vive con su esposa la señora Olivia y son padres de tres hijos dos de los cuales son de edad escolar y una pequeñita. El labora para una empresa de  bebidas como promotor de ventas, su esposa se encarga del hogar y del cuidado de la familia.
Ellos como una familia unida están solicitando este crédito para la compra de útiles escolares y de uniformes de sus niños para brindarles una mejor educación.
texts.en:
José Antonio lives with his wife Olivia. They are the parents of three children, two of school age and a little one. José works as a sales representative for a beverage company and his wife is in charge of the home and taking care of the family. They are applying for a loan as a united family to buy school stationery and uniforms for their children to offer them a better education.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha es una madre de familia de 43 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 14 y 12 años de edad en la ciudad de Monsefú, ubicada a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde que tenía doce años se dedica a la venta de pescado fresco y seco – salado en el mercado de la ciudad de Pomalca, ubicada a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo; todos los dias se levanta muy temprano para comprar su mercancía en el terminal pesquero de la ciudad de Santa Rosa (a 25 minutos de Chiclayo) y luego dirigirse a su centro de labores para ofrecérsela a sus clientes.

Los continuos viajes que hacía diariamente para sacar adelante su negocio la llevaron a ahorrar dinero junto a su marido para comprarse un auto con el que pueda facilitar el transporte diario de su mercancía, hace seis años que adquirieron la unidad móvil y desde entonces su esposo se ha dedicado también a trabajar como taxista durante las horas del día en que Martha se encuentra vendiendo en el mercado.

Estos negocios son la única fuente de ingreso económico de su hogar y día a día tratan de salir adelante, actualmente el continuo uso del automóvil ha hecho que este sufra serios desperfectos en el motor, esta situación ha motivado a que ella solicite por pirmera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la reparación de su vehículo y en el mantenimiento de su negocio con la compra de más pescado para venta.

Martha sueña con ver a sus dos hijos convertidos en profesionales, por ello se esfuerza al máximo para sacarlos adelante. Ella es muy estimada por sus vecinos y compañeros de trabajo que coinciden en considerarla una mujer honesta y responsable.
texts.en:
Martha is a mother of a family, 43 years old and lives with her husband and two children of 14 and 12 years of age in Monsefú, located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Ever since she was 12, Martha has sold fresh and dried salty fish in the market of the city of Pomalca, located 10 minutes from Chiclayo. Every day she gets up very early to buy her produce at the wharf of the city of Santa Rosa (25 minutes from Chiclayo) and later she goes to her workplace to offer her purchases to her clients. The continual trips that she made on a daily basis to advance her business led her to save money with her husband to buy herself a car, which made the daily transport of produce easier. They bought their vehicle six years ago and since then her husband has worked as a taxi driver during the hours of the day that Martha is at the market. These businesses are their only source of home income and day by day they try to move forward. However after continual use of the car, the motor has suffered serious damage and this situation has motivated Martha to apply for the first time to Kiva's field partner Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles that she intends to invest in repairing their vehicle and maintaining her business by purchasing more fish to sell. Martha dreams of seeing her two children become professionals, because of this she pushes herself to the limit to get them ahead in life. She is very highly regarded by her neighbours and work colleagues, both of whom consider her to be an honest and responsible woman.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repair and purchase of fish to sell

loans.name: Chalie

texts.en:
Chalie C. is from the village of Zone 2, Lumbia Airport Compound, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 29 years old. Chalie is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Chalie owns and operates a 'sari-sari' (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Chalie has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Chalie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Chalie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Chalie is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Chalie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Zone 2, Lumbia Airport Compound, Cagayan De Oro

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma C. is from the village of Zone 2, Lumbia Airport Compound, Cagayan De Oro. She is 45 years old, is married, and has five school-aged children. Emma owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In October 2006, Emma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Emma is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her 6th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

location.town: Zone 2, Lumbia Airport Compound, Cagayan De Oro

texts.en:
Vectoria D. is a rice grower from Veruela, Agusan del Sur in Mindanao. She has six children, 15 years old the eldest, whom she really puts all her attention to every day and night. Her dream for her children is that they will grow as responsible persons in the future.

Vectoria would like to request a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to fund her farm by buying farming necessities to obtain an abundant harvest. The income she makes from growing rice is what she hopes will provide her family with enough food and income to buy their other needs.

loans.name: Rodegunda

texts.en: Rodegunda C. is from the village of Agusan Canyon, Camp Phillips, Bukidnon. She is 51 years old, is married, and has six adult children. Rodegunda owns and operates a business providing transport services using her "habal-habal" motor vehicle (her husband as the driver) in the local community (a habal-habal is a motorcycle with an extended seat that carries 2-6 passengers). Rodegunda has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month. In 2006, Rodegunda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase items to expand her services offered. Rodegunda is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP which will be used for motor vehicle maintenance. This loan will be her 5th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children’s education. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for maintenance of the motorcycle

texts.en:
Marife D. is a rice farmer. She has four children who are all studying. Her eldest child dreamed of becoming a teacher someday. That is why, she works so hard to be able to grow her business and support the ducation of her kids.

She would like to apply a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to fund her farm by buying the farming necessities to grow her harvest. 

She said she started in CEVI last April of 2009. Now, its her second loan and she started to like the program already.

loans.name: Felixberta

texts.en: Felixberta B. is from the village of Owaon. She is 52 years old, is married, and has six school-aged children. Felixberta owns and operates a business running a food stall, selling seafood products such as fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Felixberta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Felixberta is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used as additional working capital for her business. This loan will be her 7th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 56 years old and she is married to Severino, a utility worker. They were blessed with six children. Her eldest is already in third year college, followed by her two children who were both elementary graduates, next to them is a farmer, her fourth child is also an elementary graduate and their youngest is now a first year high school student. Her family is residing at Barangay Namnama, Cabatuan Isabela, it is a rural area and it is located one kilometer from the provincial highway.
	
She is engaged in selling second hand or used clothing in their village at very low prices. Sometimes she also retails vegetables in their village for almost a year. She is earning the amount of PHP1, 500 weekly from both of her business. She decided to avail a loan amounting to PHP9, 000 that will be helpful in making her business become progressive for the welfare of her family. Luzviminda is also praying for the success of her business and it was being accompanied with action for she believes, actions can speaks louder than words.

In 2008, Julieta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. loans.name: Rosiel

texts.en:
Rosiel manages a general store business. With her business, she is able to assist her husband in providing for the needs of their family.

Rosiel is 28 years old and married to Edmir, who is employed as a food distributor. They have two children: the eldest is already in preschool while the youngest is one month old. They live in the simple village of Namnma, Cabatuan, Isabela, located near the elementary school.

Rosiel would like to request a loan of PHP 9,000 from Kiva lenders that will serve as business capital. She hopes that her weekly gross income of PHP 4,000 will increase and her business will improve and become a grocery store someday. She is doing great in her business and she has been managing her store for six years.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

texts.en:
Miriam manages a tailoring business with the aid of her old manual sewing machine in their village at Namnama Cabatuan, Isabela. She is already 56 years old and married to Eduardo.  They have three children, the eldest is a graduate in computer course and now working as a food distributor; next is working as a farm farm laborer and their youngest is a high school graduate. 

In her tailoring business, Miriam is earning around PHP2, 000 a week.  She uses her income to support their daily needs at home.  She has been working as a dressmaker for almost 30 years, Miriam is still  hoping to become a successful sewer and hopes to have her modern sewing machine to use in tailoring. For this reason, Miriam is asking financial support from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP12,000 as added business capital.

texts.en:
Emelia D., 39 years old is a rice grower in Vereula Agusan Del Sur. She was blessed with one child and is one year old already. Her dreams for her child is to grow healthy and finish a college degree in the future.

She would like to apply for a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to fund her farm by buying the farming necessities to have an abundant harvest. The loan is really helpful to grow her business more to be able to save money for future use.

Morena is 43 years old and married to Lamy, a retired soldier. They were blessed with four children: One of their children already stopped in his studies while three still are studying, one in college, one in high school and one in the primary level of education. They are living in the village of Namnama Cabatuan, Isabela.
	
She manages a hog raising business for almost five years.  Her husband on the other hand is working as a tricycle driver to sustain the daily needs of their family.  She wanted to request for a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP10, 000 as additional business capital to her hog raising business. She will utilize the loan to purchase feeds for the growth of her hogs.  She hopes to maintain her business and that someday she will become a successful businesswoman through her hard work and continuous assistance of KIVA lenders.

To make a living, Nieva owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a "mais" corn products business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising and selling crops. Nieva has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Nieva joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nieva has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. Nieva is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Nieva from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and to help with the family's daily needs.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine produces squash and string beans from her vegetable farm with the help of her husband. Her husband is a farmer and her business partner in earning a living for their family.

Josephine wants to request additional capital of PHP 10,000 for her vegetable-farming business. She will utilize the loan to buy fertilizers, hybrid seedlings, and other farm inputs that are very helpful for the growth of her crop and for it to become productive.

Josephine is 46 years old and is married to Hermogenes. They are blessed with four children and their youngest is the only one studying and she is already in college. They live happily in the simple place of Barangay Namnama, Cabatuan, Isabela.

According to Josephine, patience is the key to success. Thus, she is hoping to be able to succeed in her business endeavor by working hard and by patiently enduring the difficulties of being a farmer and being poor.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, hybrid seedlings, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene T. hails from the busy town of Binangonan, Rizal province in the Philippines. She is married to Alejandro who is 32 years old and is a fisherman. Irene is the mother of five: three boys and two girls. The eldest child is 11 years old and an elementary school pupil while the youngest is one year old.

In 1999, Irene joined ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines, with a bagful of aspirations to have access to capital for her business. She believes that to get out from the spiral of poverty, she needs a sustainable and profitably sound business.

Irene’s previous loans were carefully used as rolling capital for her fishing business. She has a fish cage (fishpond) where she cultures small fish until they are ready to harvest and sell to market. Since then, the business brings them enough proceeds and she is able to save for the future of her children.

Irene want to invest more in this business. Now on her 7th loan, she proposes a loan of 20,000 PHP as additional capital for her fish-cage business. Specifically, the loan will be used to pay for fish fry, thirty pieces of bamboo, fingerlings, bundles of fish nets and secondhand ready-made fish nets.

Irene dreams of sending her children to school until they finish college and find jobs. She also aspires to having additional fish cages for a larger harvest and a bigger income.

loans.use: To buy fish fry and equipment for her fish cage

texts.en:
Keynette is managing her own general store which she started for almost a year. She sells different commodities and refreshments and her store is located in front of their house.  Keynette would like to borrow a loan of PHP5, 000 to further improve her business. She would like her business to be more profitable to help her husband in providing the needs of their family. She is hoping that she will be given the chance to improve her business. 

Keynette is 22 years old, married and blessed with one child named Zaxia Hyley who is now one year old. Her husband is working in Parañaque, Manila.  Keynette and their child lives in the village of Punit Benito Soliven, Isabela. She is looking forward for the day that they will be able live as one whole family with a stable source of income someday.

texts.en:
Michelle G. is a rice farmer in Vereula Agusan del Sur. She is blessed with one child who is now five years old. Her husband is always supportive and hard-working and that helps her manage. Their small rice field which is 1 hectare in size, she hopes, can give her family enough income to buy food, clothing and other basic needs.

She would like to apply for loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to fund her farm by buying the farming necessities to obtain an abundant harvest.

She joined the CEVI micro credit program in April 2009. This is her second loan with CEVI because the interest rate is very low. She hopes to access more CEVI loans in the future.

Susan is 36 years old, and married to Santos, who is a laborer. They are blessed with two children who both study in elementary school. Susan's dream is that they will be able to afford to educate their children to college level. As Susan says, “If there’s a will, there’s a way”, and she will do her very best for her children's future.

Susan has a store where she sells a number of different items. She has been in business for three years and is still hoping to develop her business further. In order to make progress, she is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP from Kiva lenders. This will be of great help in making her plans a reality.

Annabelle is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from HSPFI.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia O. is a native of Binangonan, Rizal province in the Philippines. She is married to David who is 56 years old and her partner in business. She is a mother to five; five sons. All of her sons are all in legal age already ad few are still dependents to her.
During her younger age, she is engaged in fishing business. She and her husband were partners in the said business. But when they reach the age of 50 years old, they both decided to invest in business that is not so laborious and she can manage still.
In 2007, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines with bagful of hope to have access to capital to start a new business. When she received her previous loans, she invested it in the General Store business. It’s almost two years that she been doing the general store business as her primary source of income. She is happy that the business brings her enough proceeds to sustain the needs of her family.
Now on her 3rd loan, she is proposing a loan of 12,000 PHP as additional capital on her general store business. Specifically, the loan will be used to pay for 3 sacks of rice, cigarettes, liquors, diapers, softdrinks, assorted groceries and payment for transportation.
She dreams of investing more in her business to have savings for her and her husband’s future since they are getting old.

loans.use: To pay for 3 sacks of rice, cigarettes, liquors, diapers, softdrinks, assorted groceries and payment for transportation.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene C. is 35 years old and married with three children whose ages range from 6 to 16 years old. The eldest two children attend school. The family lives in the village of Sitio Napulo, Brgy. Cerantes, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. As a mother, Arlene is always looking ahead and thinking about her children's future. She makes plans for when they grow up; she wants to send them to school and get a college degree, and later have a stable job, have their own family, and be free from poverty. But then she sometimes questions how her dreams can be fulfilled because her husband's income is too small and not sufficient even to cover their household expenses.

With these aspirations in mind, Arlene began to help her husband by selling seaweed in the local market and other neighboring places. The little she earned helped defray the household expenses and support her children's school-related needs. She then decided to expand her business to earn more, and so asked around about where and how she could access additional capital to do this. It was at this time that she learned about NWTF-Project Dungganon and how it could help her financial needs. In 1996, Arlene became a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon, and she used her first loan cycle to increase the volume of her seaweed business. She diligently paid her weekly installments and maintained her good credit record so that she could take advantage of a larger loan in the next cycle. By so doing she increased her income. She then had enough capital to start another business, a general store in her neighborhood. The store now earns 3,000 PHP a month to supplement the family income.

Arlene is a shrewd businesswoman and plans her cash flow well. In her previously cycle, she borrowed 17,000 PHP, which she used to invest in her business. She was able to fully pay it on time and without any delays. This time around, for her ninth cycle loan, she is borrowing only 6,000 PHP. This is because she anticipates that demand for her products will drop because people in her neighborhood will have less disposable income as it is off-season for the biggest employers in the area – the sugar mill and sugar plantations. She intends to add the loan to her revolving working capital in her general store.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: As additional capital for the business

texts.en:
Maria is 57 years old and married to Alfredo, a village policeman. They are blessed with two children: the eldest is a college undergraduate while the youngest is a first year college student. Maria's family resides happily in the village of Namnama Cabatuan, Isabela.

Maria manages a general store business that has become an alternative source of income for her family. She is requesting 4,000 PHP from Kiva lenders as additional business capital to further improve her general store. Maria has been operating her store for 25 years and is glad that she has been able to maintain it despite life's difficulties. She hopes to improve the store and become successful in her chosen business.

loans.name: Gelien

texts.en:
Gelien D. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 19 years old and married. To make a living, Gelien owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Gelien has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Gelien joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gelien has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Gelien is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her second from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

texts.en:
Jennifer is an electronic load retailer in their village. She is 30 years old and she is living with their two children in their village in Punit Benito Soliven, Isabela. Her husband Luisito is currently working in another country as a Project Engineer. Their two children are Michael Angelo, eight years old, and Darlene Gaile, one year old. The couple sacrifices by being away from each other just to meet the daily needs and future welfare of their children who have growing needs. Jennifer hopes that someday, they will be able to send their two children to school and see them earn their degrees in college.

Jennifer retails cell phone loads for Smart and Globe subscribers. Her customers usually buy their load by sending a text message and she will also send the load through a text. She ventured into this business so she can help her husband in supporting the needs of their family. She is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 4,000 from KIVA lenders to be used as additional capital. Electronic loading is very much in demand in their village and Jennifer wants to maximize her loan and be productive in the business. She hopes that her business will be supported by KIVA lenders.

Nestly is 21 years old and she is already married.  She and her husband Arnold were gifted with a one year old son named Prince Lhary.  

Nestly is engaged in food vending business.  In the morning she sells sells vegetables which she usually purchased in Cauayan public market. In the afternoon, she will then sell different snacks like halo-halo (is a popular Filipino dessert that is a mixture of shaved ice and milk to which are added various boiled sweet beans and fruits, and served cold in a tall glass or bowl).  Aside from this she also sells barbecue stick. As a young parent, she will do everything to become a responsible mother to her eldest child and future children. Life will be difficult without her cooperation and initiative to start a business. She just hope that her business will not be affected by calamities and other factors that could possibly affect her business growth. 

Nestly is asking for financial support from KIVA lenders. She is requesting to avail a loan of PHP4, 000 to be use as her additional capital and to maintain her business.  She hopes to avail the said loan because she believes that it will make her business become progressive. And she wanted the loan to gain income by investing it to her business. She really hopes that her loan will be approved.

Yolanda is a loving and hard-working mother to her five children. She manages to support all of them through her vegetable vending business. One of her children is already a college graduate. Yolanda and her youngest son are residing in Barangay Namnama, Cabatuan, Isabela. Their house is along the provincial highway where Yolanda sells different kinds of vegetables and fruit in her small stall.

She is earning a weekly gross income of PHP 7,000 from selling vegetables. She would like to take out a loan of PHP 10,000 from KIVA lenders that will serve as additional capital for her business for it to grow and become productive. She hopes that through her business, they can uplift their life out of poverty. Yolanda shared with us that managing such a business requires a lot of patience, thus always be hard-working in everything and remain patient.

loans.name: Menchie

texts.en:
Menchie A. is from the village of Luyong in the western district of Bonbon, Opol Municipality in the province of Misamis Oriental. She is 43 years old, married and has five school-aged children. Menchie owns a retail store where she sells seafood, including fish and shrimp, to the local community. Menchie has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Menchie joined HSPFI to gain access to their financial services. Menchie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to expand her stock. Menchie is requesting a second loan of 8000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her business.

Julieta owns a shop where she sells seafood, including fish and shrimp, to the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

Julieta is requesting a second loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to buy additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue to expand her business.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en: Gilda D., who lives in the the village of Baranrgay Nanunga, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental, is 50 years old and married to Eduardo D., who is a 64 year old pensioner. They have five children ranging in age from 16 to 30 years old. The older children have finished their studies and only the two youngest are still in school. Gilda is a natural entrepreneur who is always looking for opportunities to earn more for her family and provide her children with a brighter future. Because she wanted to help her husband support their family, she engaged in a food-vending business by making different kinds of native delicacies and sold them within the community and in the neighboring villages. Aside from this, she also put up a general store adjacent to their house. With her entrepreneurial spirit whetted, Gilda was inspired to expand her food vending business and her general store and she needed additional capital to accomplish this. So she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 to have access to the much needed capital. The new loans allowed her to expand her operations, which in turn resulted in a higher income. From the subsequent loans, she was able to diversify to a third business - pig fattening and the three businesses allowed her to earn PHP 7,500 per month. She is grateful to NWTF-Project Dungganon for providing her with the means to expand her business through the easy-installment loans. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000, which was her 11th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon, did well for her business and allowed her to maintain her good credit standing when she paid off each installment on time until it was completely paid. Now on her 12th cycle, she is borrowing PHP 14,000 to add to the revolving working capital of her businesses. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her businesses

loans.name: Mastula's Group

texts.en: S. Mastula is the leader of her lending group in Jinja. She is 37 years old and married with 5 children aged between 16 – 5 years all in secondary school as she takes care of 1 orphan. She is a business lady with a produce buying business that she sells out to her customers for 11 years now. Although her business is doing well, it is mostly affected with the varying seasons hence enabling her to make 400,000/= as profits a month. Her husband is a farmer and they work hand in hand to ensure that the family needs are met. She wants to turn into a regional produce buyer being able to transport all her produce to the bigger markets in Nakawa and Owino markets. Mastula needs a loan to be able to buy more produce for business expansion.

loans.use: Buying more produce for business expansion.

loans.name: Ludina

texts.en: Ludina E. is from the village of Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 44 years old, is married, and has eight school-aged children. Ludina owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling grilled chicken parts locally know as alacart in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. Ludina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Ludina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. Flordeliza owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Flordeliza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase piglets to raise and sell. Flordeliza is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. location.town: Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Sulaiman's Group

texts.en: M. Sulaiman is a 50 year old male and a father of 10 children between the ages of 24 years and 8 months. He also helps to take care of 2 orphans, and all his children are still attending school. He is a business man involved in the sale of charcoal, milk and firewood from Mutai for 5 years now. Before this, he was a mere farmer selling his own produce until he got some capital and started with a daily business. Sulaiman has good customer care skills and good quality products and these have won him customers. At the moment, he lacks more capital to expand his businesses further with more stock. He is such a hard working and friendly man with a strong drive to succeed.

loans.use: Restocking his business by buying more charcoal and firewood for resale.
